 At TRATON Group R&D, you’re not just writing code — you’re shaping the future of transportation. You’ll be part of a high-performing, cross-functional global team, building cutting-edge navigation solutions that impact trucks on the road today and tomorrow.
   

  

 You’ll tackle real-world challenges head-on, from routing algorithms and map rendering to multi-brand scalability and performance optimization. Your work will touch multiple brands and markets, giving you unparalleled exposure to the full transportation ecosystem.
   

  

 We move fast, think bigger, and push boundaries — and we expect you to do the same. Here, innovation isn’t a buzzword; it’s a daily reality. You’ll collaborate, learn, and lead, all while helping create best-in-class solutions that make a real difference in sustainable transport.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry.
   

  

**Traton Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

  

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

  

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-25. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

  

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 John Hult, recruiting manager, at john.hult@scania.com
   

  

  

  

  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

  

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D

title: .Net Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **.Net Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Stockholm, Sweden.**
 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate possess the ability to write functional code and have a keen eye for identifying and resolving defects. Your primary objective will be to collaborate with our internal teams to design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions.
   

  

 If you have a genuine passion for the .NET framework and possess a strong understanding of software design and architecture , and you are excited about shaping the future of technology, we encourage you to apply and be part of the Expleo team in Sweden.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in requirements analysis
* Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
* Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages
* Test and deploy applications and systems
* Revise, update, refactor and debug code
* Improve existing software
* Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)
* Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a .NET Developer
* Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC))
* Knowledge of at least one of the .NET languages (e.g. C#, Visual Basic .NET) and HTML5/CSS3
* Familiarity with architecture styles/APIs (REST, RPC)
* Understanding of Agile methodologies
* Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills
* Attention to detail
* BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
* Experience with salesforce application will be beneficial


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Join a rapidly growing consulting company at the forefront of technological innovation.
* Work in a dynamic and diverse environment that values integrity and sustainability.
* Collaborate with experts in AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science.
* Opportunities for career growth and development.
* Be part of a team dedicated to creating a more secure and sustainable society.


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Software Developer
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We are seeking a skilled Software Developer with 3+ years of experience, focusing on development of test- and integration solutions for automotive and embedded software applications. This role requires strong problem-solving skills, collaboration in cross-functional teams, and the ability to work in a dynamic environment.
   

  

**About Us**
 VTAB (Virtual Truck and Bus) is a cutting-edge Software-in-the-Loop (SIL) simulation platform developed in-house at Scania and used across the TRATON Group. VTAB enables high-fidelity, closed loop testing of complex embedded systems software integrated with a wide range of vehicle models, all executed on an engineering laptop or in the Cloud.
   

  

 We believe in transforming vehicle software development by bringing simulation to the forefront. Our vision is to provide every engineer in the TRATON ecosystem with accessible, scalable, and reliable simulation tools from early design to validation and release.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build and maintain robust SW testing frameworks and test environments to support development of complex SW systems and embedded solutions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate and configure software for automotive ECU applications
* Maintain and improve version control and development workflows, ensuring CI/CD pipelines run reliably and efficiently


**Key Competence**
* Python: Strong proficiency in Python with hands-on experience developing backend systems
* Git (GitLab): Solid understanding of version control principles using Git, with hands-on experience in GitLab (or similar platforms)
* SW testing and test environments: Practical knowledge of test platforms/test environments tailored for embedded and/or automotive systems
* CI experience: Proven experience building and maintaining Continuous Integration (CI) pipelines


**Valuable Skills**
* AWS: Familiarity with cloud services for scalable infrastructure, storage, and deployment
* Dockers: Knowledge of containerization for simplifying deployment and ensuring consistency across environments
* Linux: Proficiency in working with Linux environments for development, testing, and deployment
* C/C++: Experience in developing efficient, low-level applications and understanding embedded systems programming
* Simulink experience: Ability to use Simulink for model-based design, simulation, and validation of control systems
* Automotive applications (ECU integrations and configuration): Understanding of automotive software design, integration and configuration processes for Electronic Control Units (ECUs)


**Your Environment**
 Joining the VTAB team means stepping into a collaborative, fast-moving R&D environment. You’ll work alongside developers, test engineers, system designers, and domain experts from across the TRATON Group in an agile environment.
   

  

 We're continuously improving our platform and practices — and we invite you to be part of this journey.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: frida.stam@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: NodeJS & React Tech Lead
description:
Dedicated to powering entrepreneurs, Qred is a profitable, fast-growing fintech scale-up bank. In just 10 years, we’ve grown from a startup to hitting 1 billion SEK in annual revenue supporting over 50,000 entrepreneurs and helping create 10,000+ jobs every year. We combine smart tech with real-world experience to make funding simple, fast, and fair for entrepreneurs who need it most. With strong backing, a flat organization, and bold growth plans, we’re now looking for a skilled Tech Lead to join us and shape the future of small business owners.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Tech Lead for the Acquisition team, you will lead the development efforts for acquiring new customers to Qred. You will have a crucial role throughout the entire development lifecycle - from planning to execution. You will be an integral part of our team, taking on significant responsibilities while enjoying numerous opportunities for professional development. You will lead and inspire the Acquisition team, working fullstack, help shape our technology stack, influence the technical roadmap, and drive innovation.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Be accountable for leading the architecture and vision of our applications, both backend and frontend.
* Maintain a good balance of code quality and developer experience, keeping up with the latest technologies that are out there and ensure our tech stack is always up to date.
* Provide guidance and mentor our developers to thrive to be the best of themselves through code reviews, pair programming and competence forums.
* Work closely with the product and engineering managers to create smooth, secure and high-performing user experiences in an agile manner.
* You will be a member of the tech team that includes all architects and tech leads across all engineering teams. Together, you will advance Qred's tech stack in line with the company's technical strategy.


**Preferred Experience**
* Several years of experience with React and Node.js, and a solid understanding of event-driven architecture and serverless solutions in AWS. This isn't just about building; you'll be leading and mentoring the team, owning the technical roadmap, and shaping our tech stack.
* Believes the best way to have a clean code and architecture is to write tests and ensure security and performance in the implementation.
* Able to communicate with product managers about the feasibility of business requirements - both technical and design wise.
* Vibe coding experience from tools such as copilot agent, cursor, claude code, gemini-cli etc in combination with mcp.
* Experience within onboarding flows is highly preferred.


**Why join us?**
 This is the place to be if you’re looking for a place to grow. Qred is growing fast, and our Qredsters along with it. With a non-bureaucratic organization and delegated responsibilities, we make sure there’s a short path from idea to action. In addition to our great culture, you get to work with the latest cutting-edge techniques offered by AWS, responsibility for the whole development chain, and last but not least a bunch of new competent colleagues to learn from!
   

  

**One last thing**
 This is a full-time, permanent position based from our office in Stockholm (Drottninggatan 98). While we encourage a hybrid setup, we do expect you to be at least three days per week at the office. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. The start date is flexible, but the right candidate can join us immediately.
   

  

  

  

 Qred is an international FinTech scale-up that specializes in digital financing solutions for small businesses, with operations in the Nordics, Benelux, Germany and Brazil. We are passionate about helping small businesses thrive and grow, by providing them with business loans and credit cards. Right now we’re in an exciting phase of our journey that focuses on growth through smart product development and technology fueled by international expansion.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
*Want to influence the bigger picture? At Saab, you can realise amazing innovations that keep people and societies safe. Together, we can truly make an impact – and your part matters.*
 Join our software development team at Tactical Functions, SAAB. We develop desktop applications, supporting our Electronic Warfare systems. Our products include analysis and visualization of data and real time feeds, big data, secure user transactions, amongst many other things.
   

  

 Electronic Warfare
   

  

 Electronic Warfare (EW) represents the ability to use signals such as radio, infrared or radar. To sense and protect. At the same time, provide the possibility to disrupt, deny and degrade adversaries’ ability to use EW.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 We develop applications where we take part of the entire product chain. We work mainly with software development, but also interact with the customer directly. You will be part of and take responsibility for all phases of our product lifecycles, from concept and idea, to development, test and delivery.
   

  

 What to expect
   

  

* Full stack development
* Software development in medium sized teams
* Agile development
* Possibility to take part of machine learning projects
* Good opportunities to grow within the company


**About Us**
 The software development teams at Tactical Functions are a technique driven unit that always strive for improvement. You can expect continuous feedback and open communication with both your manager and your team. We encourage initiatives in improving our products, development environment and ways of working. We highly value collaboration and having fun together. Furthermore, it is important to us that you have an accepting attitude towards people regardless of whom you meet. Respect and dignity should be keywords to you at all times
   

  

 Your Profile
   

  

 We are looking for a driven and curious software developer, who is eager to learn and always trying to improve yourself. You actively support and contribute to an innovative climate.
   

  

* Master’s degree in Computer Science (or related discipline), or equivalent work experience
* Good skills in programming, with Java, C++, etc. or equivalent
* Fluent in Swedish and English


 Desired skills:
   

  

* Knowledge and interest in AI/ML
* Experience with DevOps tools, eg. Jenkins, Git
* Proactive and reliable team player with good communications skills


 We are currently located in Järfälla, but will move to Solna in early 2026. Since you will collaborate with colleagues on other Saab sites, you might travel occasionally. Saab is a global company and could provide the possibility to work abroad.
   

  

 Security Vetting
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 23,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 If you are interested in what benefits you can take part of as an employee at Saab in Sweden, you can read more about them here
   

  

 Do you want to get to know our business and our people a little bit better? Here you can find some stories told by our employees.
   

  

 Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.

title: Senior Staff Software Engineer - Content Experience Platform
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***








**Who We Are…**





 When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the
 *storytellers* 
 bringing our characters to life, the
 *creators* 
 bringing them to your living rooms and the
 *dreamers* 
 creating what’s next…
 









 From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
 




  


 Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.
 




  


**Your New Role...** 








 The Direct to Consumer (DTC) Group is a technology company within Warner Bros Discovery. We are building a global streaming video platform (OTT), and a suite of applications to support all of our network’s brands globally. We are building modern container-based micro-services operated on AWS. Our platform covers everything from search, content catalogue, video transcoding, personalization, to global subscriptions, and much more. We enable performant streaming experiences across connected TVs, web, mobile phones, tablets, and consoles for a large footprint of WBD owned streaming services (HBO Max, Discovery+, CNN, and others). This is a growing, global engineering group crucial to WBD’s future. 
 







 We are hiring a Senior Staff Software Engineer within the DTC Content Experience Platform. The team is responsible for aggregating, enabling, and serving the personalized Content Discovery experience within our DTC streaming video platforms through our Experience Services APIs. We ensure all client applications worldwide have seamless access to the latest and relevant content metadata, personalized browse experiences and curations, and presentational elements to deliver a best-in-class content discovery experience to our hundreds of millions of streaming users globally across our different streaming service platforms. 
 



  


**Your Role Accountabilities...** 



* Drive long-term architecture and technical direction across multiple workstreams, ensuring cohesive design and scalable foundations.
* Act as a trusted technical advisor to senior product and engineering leadership—translating technical opportunities and constraints into strategic input that influences product direction and company priorities.
* Lead complex, cross-team initiatives that require deep coordination, influencing beyond formal authority.
* Guide the technical growth of the organization by mentoring Staff+ engineers, setting high standards, and sharing knowledge broadly.
* Set the bar for operational excellence, engineering velocity, and system reliability, identifying and fixing systemic issues.
* Serve as a connector across domains, bridging teams, technologies, and business contexts to deliver integrated solutions.
* Represent engineering in company-level discussions, helping translate business goals into a sustainable technical strategy.
* Take responsibility for the long-term health and evolution of core systems and infrastructure, making principled trade-offs along the way.



  


**Qualifications and Experience...** 



* At least 10 years of experience with deep expertise in Java or other JVM languages, and a strong grasp of advanced language features and performance tuning.
* Proven experience in architecting and scaling distributed systems in cloud-native environments, with microservices, asynchronous communication patterns (e.g., gRPC, Kafka), and event-driven architectures.
* Has led the design and implementation of low-latency, high-throughput APIs powering real-time systems with demanding SLAs.
* Strong knowledge of data persistence, indexing, and caching strategies, with experience optimizing PostgreSQL, Redis, Elasticsearch, and in-memory caches like Caffeine for large-scale production environments.
* Has introduced or evolved observability practices across teams, including distributed tracing with OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, or Zipkin.
* Experience leading teams in adopting and scaling infrastructure as code practices using GitOps, Terraform, ArgoCD, or Helm.
* Skilled in setting up and evolving monitoring, alerting, and incident response processes, using tools such as Prometheus, CloudWatch, Kibana, and PagerDuty.
* Practical experience with non-blocking, asynchronous, and reactive programming models using frameworks such as Spring WebFlux, Reactor, or Vert.x, with a focus on resilience and throughput.
* Demonstrated ability to evaluate and evolve technical stacks, guide technology adoption, and make forward-looking platform decisions. Has a proven track record of leading architecture and technical direction across multiple teams or domains, not just a single work stream.
* Thinks and operates at an organizational level—connecting product, technical, and operational strategy across functions.
* Recognized as a trusted technical leader who mentors Staff-level engineers and influences broader engineering culture and direction.
* Excels at navigating complexity and ambiguity—balancing short-term business impact with long-term platform evolution.
* Champions a culture of technical excellence, inclusive collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Combines deep technical expertise with strong product and business acumen to align engineering direction with company priorities.
* Proactively identifies systemic issues and opportunities across teams and leads cross-org initiatives to improve architecture, performance, and ways of working.
* Combines deep technical expertise with strong product and business acumen to align engineering direction with company priorities and challenge initiatives which don’t provide value.







**Additional Information**

  
 





  
 






 On June 9, 2025, Warner Bros. Discovery announced plans to separate into two publicly traded companies, Warner Bros. and Discovery Global, with an expected completion in mid-2026. For more details, including leadership appointments and information on individual brands, please visit our newsroom
 



 here
 



 .
 


  
 





  
 






 Although you will be hired by Warner Bros. Discovery, upon the planned separation in 2026, your employment
 

 likely will
 

 transition to Warner Bros. Company. During this period of transformation,
 

 you’ll
 

 have an exciting opportunity to lay the foundation at one of the world’s premier entertainment brands.
 


  
 
































  


**How We Get Things Done…**









 This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at
 












 www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/
 











  
 
 along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
 








**Championing Inclusion at WBD**



 Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.
 









 If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our
 
 accessibility page
 
 for instructions to submit your request.

title: Cloud SW Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for cloud software development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Cloud Software Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Here, you’ll thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as a** 
**Cloud Software Developer**
 You would develop web applications for configuring and operating our wireless locks and systems. Your primary focus would be on cloud front-end development, while also contributing to back-end functionality.
   

  

 You would be part of a cross-functional, agile software team that includes mobile and cloud developers, QA specialists, and a UX designer. Collaboration with our firmware team would be essential to understand device functionality and communication. Additionally, you would work closely with product management to support and enhance the cloud software application.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, creating specifications, and breaking down implementation work into epics and user stories.
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Participate in end-user testing activities.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in software development, including a minimum of 2 years working with Angular.
* Hands-on experience with backend development, preferably in Go (Golang), and familiarity with RESTful APIs and cloud service integrations.
* Knowledge of test automation tools such as Jest, Playwright, or Cypress, and experience with CI/CD practices using Git.
* A background in Agile Scrum development and strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred.


 Ideally, you would have experience with several of the following: AWS development (e.g., Lambda, S3, CloudFront), headless CMS—preferably Sanity, AI tools like Cursor and Copilot for code development, and Agile methodologies such as SAFe.
   

  

 You’re a proactive and open-minded individual who takes initiative and enjoys learning. As a natural problem solver, you focus on solutions rather than obstacles. You thrive in cross-functional teams, value collaboration, and are always ready to support others while also seeking help when needed. You share our belief in lean and agile principles and enjoy working in an environment where diverse expertise comes together to drive successful outcomes.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* A benefits package.
* A dynamic and inclusive work environment.
* The chance to make a meaningful impact in attracting and retaining top talent.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com .
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Cloud Software Engineer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra CloudApps-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vill du lära dig nytt, koda och ha kul på arbetsplatsen? Då har Capgemini spännande möjligheter för dig! Bli en del av vårt Cloud AWS-team där vi kombinerar mjukvarupassion med en varm och inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Vi söker Cloud Software Engineers till vårt kontor i Stockholm. Vi arbetar som mjukvaruutvecklare som använder oss utav molntjänster och AI för att leverera nya lösningar. Hos oss får du jobba med innovativa projekt inom GenAI och Agentisk AI med Amazon Q, GitHub Copilot och AWS Bedrock. Vi erbjuder stora möjligheter till karriär och lära sig nytt – oavsett om du är i början av karriären, tech lead eller arkitekt.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommeer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Utveckla mjukvarulösningar.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team med agil metodik för att producera förstklassig mjukvara.
* Implementera bästa praxis för molnarkitektur och säkerhet.
* Lära sig nya tekniker inom mjukvara, molnlösningar och AI.


**Din profil**
* 6 års erfarenhet arbetslivserfarenhet med molntjänster, inom AWS eller GCP.
* 6 års erfarenhet inom programmeringsspråk som Java, Python, Kotlin, Golang eller Node.js.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska då båda språken används i det dagliga arbetet.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och påverka på nordisk nivå. Du samarbetar med andra specialister, kompetensväxlar och bidrar till att bygga AWS-kapabilitet i Norden – samtidigt som du påverkar några av världens största bolag.
* Utvecklas genom utbildningar, certifieringar och interna initiativ- Du får tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar inom AI och AWS samt möjlighet att engagera dig i Capgeminis fokusområden som Diversity & Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness Club och Art Club.
* Njut av en engagerande arbetsplats med starkt stöd och förmåner. Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, bonusprogram, företagshälsovård och sjukvårdsförsäkring – samt en inkluderande kontorskultur med sociala aktiviteter och teambuilding.


**Ansökan**
 Känner du igen dig i beskrivningen? Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan, vi ser fram emot att läsa den!
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
   

  

*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ID-kort, och bakgrundkontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
*Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.*

title: Solution Architect
description:
*Studies show that women and underrepresented groups often hesitate to apply unless they meet every requirement. At Stegra, we’re building an impact-driven, sustainable company - and we need a diverse, inclusive team to make it happen.*
*If you share our passion but don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might be the perfect fit for this role, or another as we grow.*
 At Stegra, we’re not just building a plant, we’re proving that sustainable industry is possible. And to do that, we need people like you.
   

  

 Join a team where safety comes first. Where we support each other, learn as we go, and make space for everyone to grow and contribute. This is your chance to be part of something big - while being closer to nature and leading a balanced, purposeful life.
   

  

**What you’ll do**
 Right now, we are looking for a Solution Architect to join our Digital HR & Finance team. In this role, you will report to the Digital Domain Manager and be part of a cross-functional digital team that ensures our Finance and HR functions have the modern digital capabilities they need to power a cutting-edge steel plant.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll focus on business and solution architecture, translating needs from HR and Finance into well-structured, future-proof technical solutions. Your experience as a backend developer gives you a strong foundation to design scalable architectures and guide development teams in implementation. You’ll work closely with both business and technical teams to ensure that digital solutions are simple, maintainable, and aligned with Stegra’s digital principles.
   

  

 While you won’t be writing production code day-to-day, you will be hands-on in defining backend structures, ensuring decoupling, and aligning cross-functional development efforts around a shared architecture.
   

  

 Your day-to-day work will include, but not be limited to:
   

  

* Translate business needs into clear backend architectures, with a focus on decoupled microservices and scalable APIs
* Design solution architecture for HR and Finance systems, aligning with the broader enterprise landscape
* Break down large, complex problems into actionable technical roadmaps and development tasks
* Guide and support developers to ensure consistent implementation of architectural principles
* Work across domains to ensure technical solutions reflect real business needs and workflows
* Apply architectural thinking to system integration, data flow design, and API strategies
* Incorporate security, data protection, and access control into system designs
* Communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders


**What You’ll Bring**
 You are analytical, proactive, and motivated by finding solutions that work in practice not just on paper. You enjoy simplifying complexity and making architecture understandable and actionable for others. With a collaborative and respectful communication style, you help teams move forward with confidence. You thrive in agile environments and are eager to keep learning and evolving your craft.
   

  

 Specific to this role, we would like to see that you can tick off a fair amount of the boxes below:
   

  

* A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
* Experience working as a backend developer and within solution architecture
* Experience designing solutions for event-driven microservice architectures
* Familiarity with architectural frameworks and tools (e.g., ArchiMate or similar)
* A track record of translating business needs into clear technical solutions
* Backend development experience using Java, Kotlin, or similar languages
* Strong communication skills, able to engage across technical and business teams
* An understanding of both frontend/backend/infrastructure perspectives, even if your focus is backend
* Prior experience in stakeholder collaboration, delivery planning, or technical team leadership
* Knowledge of HR and/or Finance processes is a plus, but not required


**Benefits At Stegra**
 At Stegra, you’ll join a company where your work has real impact on the climate, the industry, and future generations. We’re building a culture rooted in safety, trust, and inclusion, where people feel supported to grow and thrive.
   

  

**Read More About Benefits At Stegra Here.**
 Here’s what makes this role unique:
   

  

* Breadth, not silos: You’ll work across multiple technical areas—backend, architecture, infrastructure, DevOps and Data—gaining deep understanding of our digital ecosystem.
* Ownership from day one: You’ll support a specific domain and act as a bridge between operations and tech, and drive solutions all the way from need to implementation and iteration.
* Close to the action: You’ll collaborate closely with stakeholders, understand their workflows, and ensure your digital solutions create real value in their day-to-day operations.


**This is Stegra**
 Stegra is on a mission to change the global steel industry by producing green hydrogen, iron, and steel - with the goal of eliminating CO₂ emissions. Instead of coal, we use green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity, meaning our primary emissions will be water and heat.
   

  

 By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitized, and sustainable plant in Boden, Northern Sweden - currently under construction. But this is just the beginning. Our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize industries beyond steel, paving the way for a cleaner future.
   

  

**Our Stockholm Office**
 Our modern Stockholm office is located on Norra Stationsgatan, close to Karolinska University Hospital in central Stockholm. Here, you’ll find a bright, collaborative workspace where cross-functional teams connect, share ideas, and drive progress. Whether you're visiting regularly or working hybrid, you'll be part of a vibrant office culture with easy access to the city’s energy and amenities.
   

  

*Founded in 2020, Stegra (formerly H2 Green Steel) was created with the purpose to decarbonize hard-to-abate industry. Construction of our first project – an integrated plant producing green hydrogen, green iron and green steel – is well underway in Boden, Sweden. Slashing emissions using green hydrogen and renewable electricity, we’re starting a clean industrial revolution. Steel is just the beginning.
   

  

 We are building a diverse and rapidly growing team spread across our site and offices in Boden and Stockholm, targeting close to 1500 employees by the end of 2025. Together, we focus on delivering green impact – for our people, customers, investors, society and planet.*

title: Field Solutions Architect, Generative AI, Google Cloud
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent practical experience.
* Experience in Python and Machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* 8 years of experience working in AI/ML as a technical sales engineer or in software engineering.
* Experience in Generative AI as a user or a developer.
* Experience delivering technical presentations and leading business value sessions to support client relationship management in the region.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience in systems design, with the ability to architect and explain data pipelines, Machine Learning (ML) pipelines, and ML training and serving approaches.
* Experience with full-stack ML engineering to seamlessly combine retrieval-based knowledge and generative text generation to implement and optimize RAG models using first-party and OSS models.
* Experience with implementing search concepts, such as indexing, scoring, relevancy, faceting, and query rewriting and expansion.
* Experience with semantic search frameworks and tools/databases such as LangChain, Faiss, and Pinecone.
* Understanding of nearest neighbor search concepts.


**About The Job**
 As a Generative AI Field Solutions Architect, you will support Google Cloud Sales and Engineering teams to incubate, pilot, and deploy Google Cloud’s AI/ML and Generative AI technology with AI native customers, large enterprises, and early-stage AI startups. You will help customers innovate faster with solutions using Google Cloud’s flexible and open infrastructure including AI Accelerators (TPU/GPU).
   

  

 In this role, you will identify, assess, and develop GenAI and AI/ML applications by applying key industry tools, techniques, and methodologies to solve problems. You will help customers leverage accelerators within their overall cloud strategy by helping run benchmarks for existing models, finding opportunities to use accelerators for new models, developing migration paths, and helping to analyze cost to performance. You will work with internal Cloud AI teams to remove roadblocks and shape the future of our offerings.
   

  

 It's an exciting time to join Google Cloud’s Go-To-Market team, leading the AI revolution for businesses worldwide. You’ll excel by leveraging Google's brand credibility—a legacy built on inventing foundational technologies and proven at scale. We’ll provide you with the world's most advanced AI portfolio, including frontier Gemini models, and the complete Vertex AI platform, helping you to solve business problems. We’re a collaborative culture providing direct access to DeepMind's engineering and research minds, empowering you to solve customer challenges. Join us to be the catalyst for our mission, drive customer success, and define the new cloud era—the market is yours.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Advise our customers by understanding the customer’s business process and objectives. Architect AI-drive, spanning Data, AI, and Infrastructure, and work with peers to include the full cloud stack into overall architecture.
* Work with customers, demonstrate features, tune models, optimize model performance, profiling, and benchmarking. Troubleshoot and find solutions to issues training/serving models in a large scale environment.
* Build repeatable technical assets such as scripts, templates, reference architectures to enable other customers and internal teams. Work cross-functionally to influence Google Cloud strategy and product direction at the intersection of infrastructure and AI/ML by advocating for enterprise customer requirements.
* Coordinate regional field enablement with leadership and work with product and partner organizations on external enablement activities.
* Travel as needed.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Release Train Engineer of Software Factory Runway VCT
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**About The VCT**
 The Software Factory Runway VCT is a value creation flow that is responsible for developing and operating tooling used in embedded development. The VCT is managing 13 teams and 140 people. Line organisations that contribute to the flow are: multiple departments within TRATON R&D (Södertälje and Munich), Scania IT and MAN Engineering Hub in Lisbon.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
 In the Role of Release Train Engineer (RTE), you will be a key member of the triad leading the VCT Software Factory Runway, collaborating with global and local stakeholders. Our key stakeholders are our global embedded development community, which we serve with embedded development tooling, both TRATON R&D and BID. You will be responsible for driving the throughput and predictability of the VCT by:
   

  

  

* Challenging the status quo constantly and not being afraid to experiment and fail.
* Designing, planning and executing the necessary ceremonies within our VCT.
* Be a servant leader for the scrum masters of your VCT, developing the way of working together with them.
* Be an active leader in the triad and management team, contribute to a collaborative, fun and ambitious team.
* Manage the communication of the VCT towards different internal and external stakeholders.
* Cooperate with the rest of the VCF to ensure that we are delivering the right value to our customers.


**Position Details**
* This is a full-time/permanent position within the global TRATON R&D matrix organisation.
* The role offers the flexibility to be based in any of the locations where the TRATON R&D organisation operates (Germany, Sweden, USA, Brazil). The majority of the staff is in Sweden.
* You will functionally report to Maria Nygren, Manager EE Information Architecture & Toolchain (TGRESI)


**Your profile**
* You have at least 5 years of experience with Agile methodology and have leadership experience in a scaled agile context. Fluent in the use of Jira and Easy Agile. Previous experience in the role of RTE is great.
* We value a proactive mindset. You take responsibility, thrive in a dynamic, fast-growing environment, and demonstrate adaptability with a hands-on approach.
* You are a collaborative team player who values service-oriented cooperation with managers and employees and fosters a positive work environment.
* You like leadership and include it in everything you do in an active way.
* You are highly interested in understanding all brands' ways of working and cultures.
* You are proficient in written and spoken English for effective communication with a global audience; knowledge of Swedish or German is a plus.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, but no later than December 16, 2025. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

**If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:**
 Maria Nygren, Manager EE Information Architecture & Toolchain (TGRESI), maria.nygren@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Vill du vara med och bygga en modern DevOps-miljö för framtidens bank- och försäkringslösningar? Vi söker en senior DevOps Engineer som vill vara drivande i att utveckla vår leveransplattform och våra molnlösningar – i en organisation där teknik, kultur och kundvärde går hand i hand.
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Rollen som DevOps Engineer är central i vår produktutveckling där fokus ligger på att effektivisera, automatisera och skala upp vår tekniska leveransförmåga. Du kommer att arbeta på en plattform där utvecklingsteam snabbt och säkert kan bygga, testa, deploya och övervaka applikationer genom välstrukturerade pipelines och self-service-lösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Etablera och vidareutveckla vår Internal Developer Platform (IDP)
* Automatisera hela utvecklingsflödet genom CI/CD-pipelines, releasehantering och deployment-strategier
* Samarbeta med produktteam, säkerhet, drift och arkitekter för att driva DevOps-praxis i hela utvecklingskedjan
* Designa och implementera robusta DevOps-lösningar i Azure Cloud (primär plattform) – AWS är meriterande
* Integrera säkerhet och regelefterlevnad-förmågor i leveranskedjan (Shift Left & DevSecOps)
* Bidra till vision, strategi och roadmap för vår gemensamma utvecklingsplattform
* Delta i tekniska communitys och kunskapsdelning över team och ARTs


 Du arbetar agilt i en organisation som tillämpar SAFe i stor skala, och du blir en viktig del i att bygga en skalbar, resilient och produktiv DevOps-miljö.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en tekniskt stark och nyfiken och brinner för automation, struktur och utvecklarupplevelse. Du har ett holistiskt tänk kring plattform och värdeskapande utveckling, och du trivs i en roll där du får kombinera teknik med samarbete, strategi och förbättringsarbete. Du är en doer med struktur och integritet – och en naturlig lagspelare i agila team.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom DevOps, systemutveckling eller plattformsutveckling
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Azure Cloud, containerplattformar som OpenShift/Kubernetes/Docker
* Djup förståelse för CI/CD-principer, infrastrukturautomatisering och pipelineförmågor
* Erfarenhet av att bygga eller arbeta med Internal Developer Platforms (IDP)
* Förmåga att skapa self-service-funktionalitet och stödja developer experience
* Kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC) med t.ex. Terraform, ARM/Bicep eller liknande
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter i DevOps (t.ex. hemlighetshantering, SAST/DAST, policy enforcement)
* Erfarenhet av arbete i agila ramverk, gärna SAFe
* Hög teknisk kommunikationsförmåga – du kan både förenkla och fördjupa beroende på målgrupp
* Grundläggande förståelse för svenska och engelska i tal och skrift och en ambition att ständigt utvecklas


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av AWS och hybrid cloud-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av observability-verktyg och metricsbaserad utveckling
* Kunskap inom GitOps, eventdriven arkitektur och serverless
* Erfarenhet från plattformsdriven utveckling i större organisationer


**Om oss**
 Process and Dev Tools är en del av Digital Solution & Operation Platform, DSOP inom vår IT-organisation Digital & IT. Vi erbjuder stöd, förmågor, verktyg, tekniska plattformar samt processer för samtliga utvecklingsteam inom Länsförsäkringar. Vi arbetar enligt SAFe, med en tydlig vision att skapa en hållbar och effektiv produktutveckling – där DevOps är en självklar grundförutsättning.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av Produkt Owners, DevOps Engineers, Scrum Masters och Process Owner som tillsammans ansvarar för våra förmågor och processer för IT-utveckling. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande laganda med högt i tak kultur och stora möjligheter till utveckling.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-21**

title: Senior Mobile Android Developer
description:
The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for an Android Developer to join the Key Device Cylinders (KDC) product unit.
   

  

 If you are passionate about mobile app development and have a track record of building successful Android applications, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Join our team in Stockholm or Kraków and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

 This is a
 **hybrid position** 
 that requires regular presence in the office - at least twice a week .
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile Android Developer**
 As an Android Developer you will develop mobile applications for our different Key Device Cylinders systems. You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and release new features
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least three years' experience of mobile Android app development, preferably with Kotlin.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with Jetpack Compose and good understanding of Android release cycle.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following: developing mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, and security technologies such as TLS, MFA, OAuth, and PKI. Experience with cross-platform languages such as React Native (Expo), Kotlin Multi-Platform, or Flutter is nice to have but not a requirement. Additionally, familiarity with the SAFe agile methodology is beneficial.
   

  

 Furthermore, you share our belief in lean and agile values, embracing an open mindset and cross-functional teams where multiple competencies collaborate to drive successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a successful career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Business Developer MAN Financial Services
description:
TRATON Finans AB is a financial services company within the business area TRATON Financial Services. We offer financing and insurance of TRATON products through our seven branches in the Nordic and Baltic countries. With a customer finance portfolio that exceeds 26 billion SEK, TRATON Finans AB is the largest financial services company within TRATON. The company has around 100 employees, of which half are located at the headquarters in Södertälje.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 The main responsibility of the Business Developer - Finance Products in TRATON Finans AB is to develop, lead, manage existing and new leasing products and services, with the aim increase profitability and efficiency while enabling increased customer value and satisfaction. This is achieved by acting on available business intelligence to investigate business development potential and assist the business and operation in developing and implementing activities to: develop offers; expand solutions portfolio; sell additional products and services; develop the network or ways to get the most out of the existing organisation thus interacting with distributors, dealers and customers.
   

  

 The area of responsibility also includes how to improve sales processes for the product portfolio
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Experience in business/product development, preferably within leasing/financial services.
* Strong analytical, communication and result-driven capabilities.
* Strategic thinker with ability to drive change.rive and follow up overall and day-to-day operations.
* Ensure knowledge-based decisions through market, customer and competitor analysis.
* Promote a customer- and result-oriented mindset.
* Identify deviations and develop action plans.
* Analyse development potential and create new leasing and financing products and services.
* Collaborate with internal teams, dealers and customers.
* Prepare business cases, benchmarks and reports.
* Support product launches and marketing activities.
* Plan and lead development projects and cross-functional initiatives.
* Ensure effective implementation, follow-up and adjustment when needed.
* Work according to the TRATON FS Way and contribute to structured processes and ongoing improvements.


**Who You Are**
* Relevant education or equivalent work experience in customer financing (product and market).
* Strong business knowledge; experience from a similar role is an advantage.
* Experience in selling leasing products and solutions.
* Proven experience in cross-functional collaboration.
* Good presentations skills.
* Knowledge of product management.
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written.


**TRATON Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. The group also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-26. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Stefan Smith, Director Business Development, TRATON Finans AB, stefan.smith@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
 #TFS

title: Applikationsutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* B.Sc eller M.Sc-examen i programvaruteknik, datavetenskap, datateknik eller liknande.
* Lång erfarenhet av Android-utveckling, applikationer eller ramverk.
* Du är van vid att arbeta med verktyg som Git, JIRA och Android Studio.
* Kunskaper om AOSP med fokus på Automotive applikationer skulle vara en stor fördel.
* erfarenhet av CID och DDV.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 21-11-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Utvecklare till våra mobila plattformar
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens användarupplevelser i en miljö där design och teknik och möts? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med moderna tekniker och vara en nyckelperson i transformationen ny arkitektur. Här får du utvecklas tillsammans med engagerade kollegor och bidra till lösningar som används av många.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som apputvecklare/frontendutvecklare i vårt designsystemteam blir du en viktig del av ett tvärfunktionellt team med fokus på att möjliggöra och dokumentera återanvändbara UI-komponenter. Du arbetar nära UX/design och andra utvecklare för att skapa konsekventa, tillgängliga och skalbara användarupplevelser. Rollen innebär att du både arbetar med dagens native-miljö och driver utvecklingen mot en mer webbaserad och hybrid arkitektur.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Utveckla återanvändbara, tillgängliga och responsiva UI-komponenter för designsystemet
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team tillsammans med UX och arkitektur
* Översätta design tokens till kod och säkerställa konsekvent användning
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla befintliga native-appar (iOS och/eller Android)
* Bidra till transformationen mot hybrid/webb-arkitektur, inklusive Micro Frontends
* Arbeta med kodstandarder, naming conventions och delad frontendarkitektur
* Leda och skapa samsyn med andra utvecklare kring arkitektur, komponentdelning och API-integrationer


**Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst**
* Stark erfarenhet av nativeutveckling i iOS och/eller Android (Kotlin)
* God förståelse för plattformspecifika designmönster och komponentbibliotek
* Kunskap om tillgänglighet och responsivitet i mobila gränssnitt
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och dokumentera återanvändbara UI-komponenter för designsystem
* Förståelse för design tokens och hur dessa implementeras i kod
* Systemtänkande med detaljfokus och förmåga att se helheten
* Vana att arbeta med kodstandarder och delad frontendarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av samverkan kring versionshantering och styrning av designsystem
* Förmåga att leda och skapa samsyn med andra utvecklare kring arkitektur och kodstandarder


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att utveckla webb med moderna JavaScript-ramverk, exempelvis React eller Vue
* Kännedom om eller intresse för Micro Frontend-arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av att bygga appgränssnitt i webbhybrider (t.ex. via WebView)
* Intresse för DevOps och CI/CD för mobil/webb
* Grundläggande förståelse för webbanalys och mätbar UX
* Förmåga att coacha andra utvecklare i frontendkod och komponentstruktur


 Som person är du kommunikativ och pedagogisk, med en genuin vilja att samarbeta och bygga tillsammans med andra. Du förklarar principer och lösningar tydligt och inkluderande för olika målgrupper. Du är coachande och vägleder med ödmjuk expertis, och driver designbeslut utan prestige. Du har ett starkt systemtänkande med detaljfokus, och trivs med att skapa bästa möjliga användarupplevelse där design och teknik samspelar.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Till vardags sitter du i Designsystemteamet och du rapporterar till chefen för Arkitektur, Teknologi och Plattformar inom avdelningen Customer Experience på LFAB. Här värdesätter vi samarbete, innovation och öppenhet. Vi arbetar tillsammans för att skapa hållbara och användarvänliga lösningar, och uppmuntrar till delaktighet och kunskapsutbyte mellan alla roller. Här får du möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas, både i din roll och tillsammans med teamet.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-02**

title: Lead Developer
description:
I september lanserade vi Kvartals nya digitala plattform, men detta var bara första steget och vi söker nu en driven första inhouseutvecklare och nyckelspelare för våra framtida tekniska satsningar.
   

  

 I din roll som Lead Developer på Kvartal kommer du vidareutveckla vår nya plattform i samråd med produktägare, VD och andra nyckelpersoner. Du utökar och kompletterar den tekniska kompetens som finns hos våra externa partners, och är en central spelare i det framtida utvecklingsteamet här på Kvartal.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
 Som Lead Developer på kvartal ansvarar du för:
   

  

* Utveckling: Vidareutveckla vår plattform i tätt samarbete med interna nyckelpersoner på Kvartal såväl som externa konsulter.
* Teknisk ledning: Planera och vägleda utvecklingsarbetet från idéstadie till driftsättning. Säkerställa att vår plattform fortsätter hålla en hög standard.
* Teamledning och kompetensutveckling: Leda och inspirera nya utvecklare i takt med att utvecklingsteamet utökas. Även hjälpa till med onboarding och personalutveckling.


**Vem är du?**
* Du har flerårig (5+ år) erfarenhet av modern systemutveckling med ramverk som NextJS, React Native - alternativt utvecklat hela applikationer i Java, Typescript och/eller Go.
* Tidigare arbetet med Google Cloud Platform eller AWS
* Du har erfarenhet av att leda eller coacha andra utvecklare, formellt eller informellt.
* Du har god kommunikationsförmåga
* Du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs med att skapa struktur i en föränderlig miljö.
* Trivs i en miljö där mycket händer snabbt och med högt i tak
* Är social, lösningsorienterad och ser dig själv som en nyckelspelare snarare än en ensamvarg


 Vi ser också positivt på att du har ett intresse för journalistik.
   

  

**Om Kvartal**
 Kvartal är nästa generations journalistiska plattform med en vision om ett bättre offentligt samtal. Vi publicerar fördjupande texter och poddar och sedan hösten 2025 även löpande nyhetsbevakning av det viktigaste som händer i Sverige och världen.
   

  

 Sedan vår återlansering som kommersiellt bolag hösten 2022 har vi gått från 0 till 30 000 betalande prenumeranter och från 5 till över 25 anställda. Kvartal är därmed Sveriges genom tiderna snabbast växande digitala mediehus.
   

  

**Praktiskt om tjänsten**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Omfattning & arbetssätt**
 Heltid, hybridanställd med kontor 2-3 dagar i veckan. Viss helgtäckning kan förekomma och kompenseras med kompdagar.
   

  

 Start: Q4 2025 – intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Innan du skickar in din ansökan: Ta del av Kvartals poddar och övriga innehåll för att förstå vårt varumärke.
   

  

 Ansök via jobb.kvartal.se så snart som möjligt – vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Visa oss hur just du kan lyfta Kvartals digitala tillväxt till nästa nivå!

title: iOS Utvecklare till B3 Mobile
description:
B3 Mobile är koncernens spetsbolag för apputveckling. Vi bygger framtidens digitala lösningar tillsammans med några av världens mest spännande kunder – i Stockholm och internationellt. Våra projekt spänner över iOS, Android, Kotlin, Swift, TypeScript, React Native, Java och mycket mer.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en erfaren iOS-utvecklare som vill ta nästa steg i karriären och bli en del av vårt passionerade team.
   

  

**Rollen**
 Hos oss får du arbeta nära andra skickliga utvecklare, UX-designers och projektledare – både in-house och ute hos kund. Vi vill inte bara bygga det kunden ber om, utan gärna leda utvecklingen, modernisera och driva på användandet av de senaste teknikerna inom iOS när det behövs.
   

  

 Vi jobbar primärt med Swift och SwiftUI, men erfarenhet av UIKit och andra delar av Apples ekosystem är alltid meriterande. Kännedom om Objective‑C kan vara värdefullt, men är inget krav.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som**
* Har minst 6 års erfarenhet av iOS-utveckling
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i Swift, SwiftUI och Xcode
* Har erfarenhet av UIKit och gärna insyn i övriga delar av ekosystemet
* Har vana av byggautomatisering (t.ex. Fastlane, Xcode Cloud)
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet av testning och unittester (Swift Testing, XCTest)
* Skriver ren, hållbar, läsbar, säker, modulär och testbar kod
* Är proaktiv och gillar att ta initiativ hos kund
* Har en bakgrund som civilingenjör eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat


**Därför ska du välja oss**
 Vi erbjuder mer än bara ett jobb – hos oss får du:
   

  

* Möjlighet att jobba med tekniskt utmanande lösningar för högprofilerade kunder.
* Friheten att alltid ha de bästa verktygen: snabb dator, gott om testtelefoner, rätt tangentbord, alla kablar och licenser du behöver – på eget initiativ.
* Flexibelt upplägg med hybridmodell (en dag i veckan på kontoret för gemenskap och kunskapsutbyte).
* En arbetsplats där du kan växa och utforska de senaste teknikerna tillsammans med ett starkt team.
* Satsningar på ditt välmående – från friskvårdsbidrag till en arbetsmiljö där balans mellan jobb och fritid är en självklarhet.


 Vi tror på energi, nyfikenhet och att dela erfarenheter. Hos oss är olikheter en styrka, och vi vill att du ska känna att du kan växa – både som utvecklare och som människa.
   

  

 För mer information kontakta VD Camilla Landén på camilla.landen@b3.se

title: Senior Back end Developer
description:
Vill du vara kollega med riktigt grymma och erfarna utvecklare som älskar att hålla koll på den senaste tekniken? Tycker du dessutom att sammanhållning är viktigt och att det är kul att dela med dig av dina kunskaper?
   

  

 Du kommer ha runt 25 härliga och drivna kollegor i vårt lilla bolag och ca 1000 medarbetare till om du så önskar inom B3 koncernen. På B3 CodeRight har vi en genomsnittlig arbetslivserfarenhet på över 15 år.
   

  

**Vem vi söker:**
 Du brinner för att designa och implementera robusta och skalbara backend-lösningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad på det senaste. Du är proaktiv, lyhörd och pragmatisk. Vi tycker att det är viktigt att använda rätt teknik/lösning för situationen. Om motiverat, gärna den senaste tekniken.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Tekniska färdigheter: Minst 10 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling på Microsoft stacken (C#, .NET, Azure)
* Meriterande: Microservices, Containerteknologier, CI/CD, om du vid behov även kan ta rollen som lösningsarkitekt och/eller frontendutvecklare.
* Språkkunskaper: Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)


**Vad väntar du på?** 
 Skicka din ansökan nu!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? Tveka inte att höra av dig till VD Christian Bratt - Tel: 0702 75 48 40 /
 **christian.bratt@b3.se**
 Tyvärr kan vi ej ta emot e-postansökningar p.g.a. GDPR.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm eller pendlingsavstånd.

title: Logistics Developer
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a data-driven and curious Logistics Developer to join our Group Operations team at Instabee. In this role, you’ll help shape how parcels move between merchants, terminals, and markets — improving the efficiency and structure of our first- and middle-mile network.
   

  

 You’ll combine analytical problem-solving with hands-on operational understanding. One day you might deep dive into route data and build a model to identify bottlenecks, and the next you’ll collaborate with our local Operations Managers to test new ways of improving transport flows.
   

  

 This is a great next step for someone who’s started their career in analytics, operations, or consulting and wants to apply those skills in a fast-moving, international company — no previous logistics experience required.
   

  

**Some of the things you will do**
* Analyze transport data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and improvement opportunities
* Support local market teams in designing and optimizing first- and middle-mile routes
* Build and maintain dashboards and models to guide operational decisions
* Collaborate with Product and Tech on tools and processes that make route planning smarter
* Turn insights into actions by testing, validating, and implementing improvements


**Your future team**
 You’ll be part of Group Operations, a small but high-impact team that works across all Instabee markets (Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, and the Netherlands). The team brings together people who love combining structure, data, and collaboration to solve real operational challenges.
   

  

 You’ll report to the Manager First and Middle Mile, who will support your learning and development, and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders — from Operations Managers in the field to Product Managers and Analysts at HQ.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 You have an analytical mindset and a genuine curiosity for how complex systems work. You like solving problems through data, but also enjoy being close to operations and seeing your ideas take shape in real life.
   

  

* 0-2 years of experience from an analytical, operations, or consulting role
* Strong analytical skills and solid proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) or SQL/Snowflake is a plus
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* A relevant degree in engineering, business, mathematics, or similar field
* Fluent in English


**More About You**
 You’re structured, proactive, and thrive in environments where not everything is defined yet. You like connecting dots across data, tools, and people — and you’re not afraid to get your hands dirty to make things happen.
   

  

 If you enjoy switching between strategic thinking and practical problem-solving, you’ll feel right at home here
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
