 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
* ⏰ Hybrid setup and flexible working hours


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Senior Utvecklare/Tech Lead
description:
På Sogeti tror vi att det bästa finns inom oss alla. Oavsett om du är i början av din karriär eller redan på toppen av ditt spel, kommer vi att uppmuntra dig att nå din fulla potential och bli bättre. Genom vår gemensamma passion för teknik, vår entreprenöriella kultur och vårt fokus på kontinuerligt lärande, kommer vi att ge dig allt du behöver för att göra ditt bästa arbete och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

**Senior Utvecklare\Tech Lead**
**Om rollen**
 Är du en erfaren utvecklare med en passion för arkitektur och lösningsdesign? Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en nyckelspelare i att forma framtidens tekniska lösningar? Då är detta möjligheten för dig! Vi erbjuder spännande, varierande och trygga uppdrag inom samhällets viktigaste områden.  Sogeti Stockholm satsar stort på att expandera inom flera IT-kompetenser. Vi har fått förtroendet från en av våra stora kunder inom offentlig sektor som deras långsiktiga strategiska partner.  Det innebär otaliga spännande möjligheter för dig som vill vara en del av Sogetis framgång!
   

  

*I den här rollen kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Design och implementering av robusta, skalbara och tekniska lösningar.
* Arbete nära utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter för att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar möter behoven.
* Förståelse och omvandling av verksamhetens mål och utmaningar till krav för att skapa värdeskapande lösningar.


**Din profil**
* Högskole/universitetsutbildning om minst 180hp inom systemvetenskap, IT eller ingenjörsutbildning.
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med arkitekturfrågor och lösningsdesign i rollen som utvecklare, lead engineer/developer, tech lead, lösningsarkitekt eller liknande.
* Är metodiskt driven, har vana att arbeta systematiskt och tycker om att lära sig ny teknologi.
* En förmåga att se till kundens helhetsbild och drivs av att vara organiserad och planerad i komplexa miljöer.
* En mycket god kommunikationsförmåga samt mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
 Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
   

  

 Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
   

  

 Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
   

  

 Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.
   

  

**Ansökan**
*Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Simon Karlsson på simon.karlsson@sogeti.se*
*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
 Sogeti Sverige, en del av Capgemini-koncernen, med 21 kontor och 1300 medarbetare, skapar affärsvärde med teknologi för organisationer som behöver införa innovation snabbt och som vill ha en lokal partner med global skalbarhet. Med en hands-on-kultur och närhet till kunderna, implementerar Sogeti lösningar som hjälper organisationer att arbeta snabbare, bättre och smartare. Genom att kombinera agilitet och snabb implementation via en DevOps-ansats, levererar Sogeti innovativa lösningar inom test- och kvalitetssäkring, molnet och systemutveckling, förstärkta av AI, data och automation.

title: Senior System utvecklare
description:
Req ID:495530
   

  

 På Alstom förstår vi tågbranschen och vad som får människor att förflytta sig. Från höghastighetståg, tunnelbanor, monorails och spårvagnar till kompletta system, tjänster, infrastruktur, signalering och digital mobilitet – vi erbjuder våra mångsidiga kunder det bredaste utbudet i branschen. Varje dag leder 80 000 kollegor vägen mot grönare och smartare mobilitet världen över, kopplar samman städer och minskar koldioxidutsläpp samtidigt som vi ersätter bilar.
   

  

 Alstom är den största aktören på den svenska järnvägsmarknaden med över 1 000 levererade tåg och flera stora underhållskontrakt, där vi erbjuder underhåll i verkstäder från norr till söder. Företaget leder också ERTMS-utrullningen i Sverige, både ombord och spårbundet.
   

  

 Nu söker vi dig som vill vara en nyckelspelare i vår resa mot framtidens trafikledningssystem som:
   

  

**Senior System utvecklare – Trafikledningssystem**
 Placeringsort:
 **Stockholm**
**Din framtida roll – gör skillnad på riktigt:**
 Som Senior System utvecklare hos Alstom får du en central roll i att modernisera, designa och utveckla funktioner för våra innovativa Trafikledningssystem (TMS). Här får du chansen att använda din tekniska kompetens i en dynamisk miljö där du samarbetar med kunder och utvecklingsteam. Du är med och skapar lösningar som förbättrar både säkerheten och effektiviteten för framtidens transportsystem.
   

  

**Vad du kommer att göra:**
* Skapa tekniska lösningar som generar kundvärde för TMS
* Föra och leda tekniska diskussioner tillsammans med kund
* Ta välgrundade tekniska beslut tillsammans med teamet
* Ta rollen som teknisk ledare i teamet
* Ansvarar för EBICOS systemet presetanda hos kund
* Utveckla mjukvarufunktioner i produktfamiljen Ebicos 900.
* Delta aktivt i leveransprojekt i tätt samarbete med kund.
* Underhålla och skriva dokumentation för mjukvarulösningar.
* Arbeta nära ett engagerat och mångsidigt team för att uppnå gemensamma mål.
* Driftsättning av mjukvaran hos kund


**Om dig – vi söker framtidens stjärna:**
 Vi värdesätter driv och engagemang, men tror att följande egenskaper hjälper dig att lyckas:
   

  

* Examen inom teknik eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av modernisering
* Gedigen erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling, gärna inom järnvägsbranschen eller liknande.
* Expertis i programmering, särskilt i C#, samt erfarenhet av krav- och testdriven utveckling.
* AI hjälpmendel för effektivisering av produkt och utvecklingscykeln
* Flytande svenska och engelska.
* Erfarenhet av agil utveckling och att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.
* Extra plus om du har erfarenhet av Delphi och/eller Pascal.


**Varför Alstom?**
 På Alstom blir du en del av ett team som är engagerat i att forma framtidens hållbara transporter med innovation och syfte. Att ansluta sig till oss innebär att vara en del av ett globalt samhälle som är dedikerat till excellens och att skapa en säker miljö för vår verksamhet. Är du redo att gå med i ett verkligt internationellt samhälle av fantastiska människor på en utmanande resa med en konkret påverkan och ett meningsfullt syfte?
   

  

**Viktigt att veta**
 Eftersom tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad, genomför vi en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen kapitel 3. Därför krävs svenskt eller EU-medborgarskap
   

  

**Som ett globalt företag är vi en arbetsgivare som främjar lika möjligheter och firar mångfald i de över 70 länder vi verkar i. Vi är engagerade i att skapa en inkluderande arbetsplats för alla.**

title: Data Engineer – Stockholm
description:
Data Engineer till Stockholm som vill lösa uppgifter genom modern teknik, tillsammans med ett stort nätverk Data- och Analysexperter.
   

  

*Är du en erfaren Data Engineer, BI-utvecklare/BI-konsult eller ETL-utvecklare? Drömmer du om att fortsätta din professionella resa tillsammans med ett team kunniga kollegor? Motiveras du av att arbeta med moderna teknologier och lösa problem för kunder inom olika branscher kan DU vara vår nästa Data Engineer!*
 Våra närmare 100 dataexperter i Sverige jobbar med datalösningar inom nästan alla teknologier. Ett vanligt projekt varierar i längd från en månad till några år, och situationen kan justeras baserat på dina önskemål.
   

  

**Träffa en Solitan**
 Möt
 **Clara Lundström,** 
 en Data Engineer här på Solita. Hon arbetar i ett projekt för ett globalt företag inom facility service, det största i Norden. Clara, tillsammans med ett team av Solita-entusiaster, belyser datalandskapet och använder data från olika källor för att skapa visualiseringar. Erfaren med molnverktyg arbetar hon med data, automation och transformation.
   

  

*“Att arbeta som konsult på Solita är varierat samtidigt som du har tillgång till ett stort nätverk av experter inom många olika områden. Det ger utmärkta möjligheter att utvecklas i din roll, vare sig det handlar om att bredda dina kunskaper eller specialisera dig. Anledningen till att jag trivs så bra på Solita är den vänliga, stödjande och opretentiösa atmosfären.”*
**Hur är det att jobba på Solita?**
 Solitas företagskultur är annorlunda många andra företags, den handlar om autonomi, att stötta och växa tillsammans med våra kollegor samt att leva våra värdeord – passion, courage, easy-going och caring.
   

  

 Rent konkret innebär det ett företag som har genomtänkta interna tillväxtvägar, att det finns spännande kundprojekt och erfarna kollegor som är omtänksamma och passionerade. Du kommer också få chansen att arbeta med en stor bredd av projekt och branscher där du stöttar och hjälper kund med faktiska affärspåverkande beslut som lämnar avtryck och består. Utöver detta har vi även partnerskap med en mängd tech-företag såsom, GCP, AWS, Snowflake för att nämna några.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Som Data Engineer på Solita bygger du grunden för datadrivna lösningar. Du utvecklar, testar och underhåller datapipelines, samtidigt som du ansvarar för att plattformsinfrastruktur och verktyg fungerar som de ska. Arbetet innebär att optimera prestanda i datalager, stötta vid miljöuppsättning och bidra till att skapa återanvändbara dataset och modeller. Du trivs i agila miljöer och gillar att vägleda mer juniora kollegor.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av data pipelines, datamodellering, datalager och grundläggande analys eller enklare visualisering önskas. Vi jobbar främst med tekniker som Snowflake, Matillion, dbt, Databricks, MS Fabric, Data Factory och BigQuery – ofta i molnet och huvudsakligen i Python eller SQL. Vi jobbar ofta i molnet och arbetar primärt i Python och SQL.
   

  

 Som konsult på Solita handlar arbetet inte bara om det tekniska – att kommunicera med kund i förklaring av tekniska lösningar, tolkande av deras behov och att hantera potentiella problem du kommer få hantera så vana med att kommunicera med stakeholders och kunder är en bra erafarenhet. Vi arbetar autonomt på Solita, så att vara van att diktera och planera upp sitt arbete självständigt behövs. Du behärskar även svenska och engelska flytande
   

  

**En Dag På Solita**
 En dag på Solita kan ofta starta med ett standup-möte med kund och dina team-medlemmar, där ni stämmer av agendan för dagen för veckan. Sen kliver du in i ditt kodnära arbete: byggande av data pipelines, programmering i python/SQL, arbete med data och byggande i cloud. Under dagen kan det dyka upp ad-hoc möten med kund, kollegor som behöver stöttning eller helt enkelt att du lyssnar på våra interna utbildningsmöten; infosessions, som kan handla om allt relaterat till Solita och branschen. Dagen fortsätter ofta med det kod nära arbetet, möten med kollegor och kund och inte minst – fika!
   

  

 Du kan även ha interna projekt såsom att köra en dragning på vår Data Academy eller annat på din to-do list!
   

  

 Do you want to learn more about what it is like working at Solita as a Data Engineer? Read more about Lisa and her Story here! https://www.solita.fi/blogs/people-of-solita-lisa-kyhlberg-senior-data-engineer/
   

  

**Vår kundmålgrupp**
 Vi riktar oss mot företag och organisationer inom alla branscher som vill utnyttja kraften i data för att förbättra sina affärsprocesser och fatta bättre beslut. Våra kunder finns inom bland annat inom produktutveckling, hälsa, industri, försäkring, kommunikation, bank och elförsörjning. Vi arbetar med både stora och små företag som har behov av avancerade datalösningar och analys
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Vår företagskultur är väldigt viktig för oss. Vi värdesätter låg hierarki, självständighet och ansvar, värdeskapande arbete och trevliga kollegor. Här kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, och här kan du bläddra bland våra tech-bloggar.
   

  

* Meningsfulla projekt: Arbeta i en agil miljö där du kan påverka teknikval och arbetssätt för att skapa de bästa lösningarna
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete med flextider– läs mer från vår blogg.
* Ständig utveckling: Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling för att säkerställa att våra medarbetare ligger längst fram i teknikutvecklingen.
* Innovativ kultur: Arbeta tillsammans med några av de främsta experterna inom data, analys och utveckling


 Utöver detta får du även ta del av följande
 **förmåner** 
 :
   

  

 💰 Fast lön oberoende av beläggningsgrad med möjlighet till löneväxling till ditt pensionssparande
   

  

 🏖️ 30 semesterdagar
   

  

 😃 Sjukvårdsförsäkring för både din mentala och fysiska hälsa som täcker dig även utanför tjänstetid
   

  

 🏋️‍♀️ Friskvårdsbidrag på 5000 kr via Benify.
   

  

 💻 Ett brett nätverk av erfarna specialister från olika områden inom tech att samarbeta med
   

  

 🔗 Intern coach för att stödja ditt välbefinnande
   

  

 🪩 After Work och hobbyaktiviteter
   

  

 🥐 Fredagsfrukost
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vid frågor; kontakta jacob.beck(at)solita.se eller ansök här. Du kan också connecta med Jacob på LinkedIn på https://www.linkedin.com/in/jacob-beck-/. Vi uppskattar dina färdigheter, men vi är också ivriga att lära oss om essensen i din motivation och hur du ser din tillväxt framför dig. Dela ditt CV nedan så återkommer vi så fort vi kan!
   

  

**Hur ser processen ut?**
 I rekryteringsprocessen tror vi på en gedigen och effektiv process. Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Om vi ser en potentiell matchning, bjuder vi in dig till ett första möte för att lära känna dig och berätta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar på Solita. I andra intervjun fokuserar vi på din tekniska kompetens och din erfarenhet. Om allt går bra tar vi oss vidare till sista steget där vi presenterar ett erbjudande och välkomnar dig som ny Solitan!
   

  

 Sign up to our newsletter to hear about the latest news, upcoming events and open positions at Solita
   

  

 Subscribe

title: Integrationsutvecklare till Peab
description:
Integrationsutvecklare Azure till PEAB
   

  

 I Solna
   

  

 Är du en driven och teknikintresserad utvecklare med passion för integrationer i Azure? Vi söker nu en engagerad Integrationsutvecklare som vill vara med och bygga framtidens samhällslösningar hos Peab.
   

  

 Om Peab
   

  

 Peab är den nordiska samhällsbyggaren med lokal närvaro och arbetar för att skapa hållbara lösningar som gör skillnad – både för dagens och framtidens samhälle. Genom att kombinera innovation, engagemang och ett tydligt kundfokus bygger Peab vardagen där livet levs. Peabs kärnvärden som är jordnära, utvecklande, personliga och pålitliga utgör grunden för verksamheten och genomsyrar allt arbete. Att vara en del av Peab innebär en möjlighet att bidra med teknisk expertis för att forma framtidens integrationer och processer på en spännande och utvecklande resa.
   

  

 Rollen som Integrationsutvecklare
   

  

 Som Integrationsutvecklare hos Peab kommer du att ingå i ett erfaret team om nio personer som arbetar med avancerade integrationslösningar inom Azure. Rollen erbjuder en dynamisk och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att arbeta med spännande projekt och modern teknik.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden Inkluderar**
* Bygga och underhålla integrationslösningar med verktyg som Azure Logic Apps, API Management och Functions.
* Säkerställa effektiva dataflöden mellan system genom att designa smarta lösningar.
* Implementera pipelines med Azure DevOps för automatiserad utveckling och distribution.
* Skapa arbetsflöden och processer för att optimera verksamhetens effektivitet.
* Övervaka och analysera integrationers prestanda med hjälp av Azure Monitor.
* Identifiera och åtgärda problem för att garantera stabilitet och hög tillgänglighet.
* Utveckla och dokumentera API:er samt säkerställa att de är skyddade.
* Arbeta med dataskydd och följa organisationens säkerhetskrav.
* Samarbeta med kollegor inom utveckling, arkitektur och verksamheten för att möta affärsbehov.
* Dokumentera och sprida kunskap inom teamet för långsiktig förvaltning.


 Din profil
   

  

 Vi Söker Dig Som Har En Analytisk Och Strukturerad Approach Med En Förmåga Att Omsätta Krav Till Innovativa Lösningar. Du Är Kommunikativ Och Trivs i Team Där Samarbete Är Nyckeln Till Framgång. För Att Lyckas i Rollen Ser Vi Gärna Att Du Har Följande Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Talar flytande svenska
* Erfarenhet av integrationsutveckling inom Azure.
* Erfarenhet av verktyg som Azure Logic Apps, Service Bus, Event Grid och API Management.
* Grundläggande förståelse för SQL, REST API:er, JSON och XML.
* Erfarenhet av versionshantering (Git) och CI/CD-pipelines i Azure DevOps.


 Vi anser det som meriterande om du har erfarenhet av BizTalk Server eller Nodinite.
   

  

 Varför Peab?
   

  

**Hos Peab Får Du Möjligheten Att**
* Arbeta med den senaste tekniken inom Azure.
* Delta i utvecklingen av innovativa och hållbara lösningar.
* Utvecklas både professionellt och personligt genom utbildningar och spännande projekt.
* Bidra till att skapa framtidens samhälle i en organisation som sätter människa och miljö i fokus.


 Peab erbjuder en inkluderande företagskultur och en miljö där dina idéer och initiativ uppskattas.
   

  

*Peab har i denna rekrytering valt att samarbeta med Awexia Executive Search. Alla frågor avseende tjänsten hänvisas till Fredrik Hammarwall som är ansvarig rekryteringskonsult via mail: fredrik.hammarwall@awexia.com alternativt telefon +46 76 318 36 06.*
**Awexia – Vi skapar framgång genom människor**
 Framgångsrika företag byggs inte av strategier och system – de byggs av människor. På Awexia är vi specialister på att identifiera, attrahera och utveckla de ledare och nyckelpersoner som gör skillnaden mellan att följa utvecklingen och att driva den.
   

  

 Vi arbetar nära våra kunder som en
 **strategisk partner** 
 , med fokus på att förstå affären, kulturen och de långsiktiga målen.
   

  

 Genom
 **Executive Search, Rekrytering, Interim Management, Consulting och Styrelserekrytering** 
 säkerställer vi att rätt kompetens finns på plats – inte bara idag, utan också för framtiden.
   

  

 Med Erfarenhet, Engagemang Och Precision Hjälper Vi Företag Att Växa, Förändras Och Möta Framtidens Utmaningar. Vårt Uppdrag Är Tydligt
   

  

**Att skapa värde och möjligheter genom människor.**

title: Qlik Engineer
description:
***This is us***


At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.  

  



***This is the job***

  

As a Qlik Developer **working as a subcontractor via Avenga on a part-time assignment (50%)**, you will play a key role in shaping data-driven insights for the end client. This **fully remote consulting role** involves designing, building, and maintaining scalable BI solutions using Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud, and QlikView. You will collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their analytical needs and translate them into efficient, intuitive dashboards and data models. Your work will directly support smarter decision-making, ensuring high data quality, reliable performance, and continuous improvement of the client’s analytics landscape.  

  

***This is you***

* + Strong experience with Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud, and QlikView development.
	+ Skilled in SQL and understand data modeling principles well.
	+ Can translate business requirements into clear, structured analytical solutions.
	+ Have excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
	+ Communicate confidently with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
	+ Detail-oriented and committed to high data quality and thorough testing.
	+ Experience with Python scripting and/or Databricks is a plus.
	+ You thrive in a remote consulting environment and take ownership of your delivery.
	+ Available to start immediately.
	+ Fluent in Swedish, both spoken and written.
* 

***This is your role***


In this role, you will develop, optimize, and maintain Qlik Sense and QlikView applications and data models. You will manage deployments and configurations in Qlik Cloud environments, write and optimize SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and integration, and collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions. You will ensure data quality, performance, and reliability across BI solutions, conduct thorough testing, troubleshooting, and performance tuning of dashboards and data models, and work with cross-functional teams to integrate Qlik solutions with other platforms, such as Databricks.

***What awaits you at Avenga?***

*At Avenga, everyone matters. We provide equal opportunities in recruitment, career development, and leadership, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, religion, or any other characteristic. We are committed to fostering a work environment where our diverse community of employees, candidates, and business partners actively shapes our growth. By bringing together people from different backgrounds and experiences, we build a workplace where everyone feels free to be themselves while honoring the boundaries of others.*
company_description: Avenga is an international consultancy and technology solutions partner with 6000+ specialists globally.

title: Staff Product Manager
description:
At Hive Streaming, we enable the world’s largest enterprises to use live video as a strategic tool for communication, alignment, and impact. Trusted by more than 130 global customers, Hive combines market-leading video distribution technology with communication analytics to ensure flawless video experiences and measurable engagement.


Our users are IT and Network professionals who rely on Hive every day to ensure flawless video delivery, Event Producers who ensure optimal video experience during internal company events, Leaders and Communications professionals who plan and execute powerful video-enabled strategies to deliver measurable impact.


What do we do - really? No better way to explain what Hive actually does than with a video Watch the video below to find out more


### **About the role**

As Staff Product Manager, you will lead the product direction and execution for Hive’s Video Infrastructure product area. You are part of the Product organization, reporting to CPO, working closely with Product Managers specialized in Video Optimization, Partner Ecosystem, and Video Analytics products. You will work closely with our Berlin-based Engineering team for this Product area, while based in our Stockholm headquarters, where our Product, UX Design, and the rest of our Engineering organization are located.


### **Your mission**

You shape and drive the product direction for Hive’s Video Infrastructure product area, which includes Video Optimization propositions, foundational components enabling the broader Hive portfolio, integrations to and co-developments with our partner ecosystem. This is a technical product area, where you work cross-functionally with Engineering, to build both evolve Hive portfolio foundations and our Video Optimization propositions. Through collaboration and coaching, you also help strengthen product practices in adjacent Video Analytics products.


### **Responsibilities**

* Lead the product direction and roadmap for Hive’s video infrastructure product area, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer outcomes.
* Together with the Engineering team, translate customer needs into high-impact product capabilities while handling technical complexity.
* Enable cohesive portfolio experiences and customer growth journeys across Video Infrastructure, Video Experience, and Video Analytics products by evolving our foundational components
* Drive product discovery and delivery for a high-impact technical domain, balancing strategic trade-offs and execution impact.
* Influence cross-team initiatives that enable new capabilities across the portfolio.
* Engage with customers and partners in growth-oriented collaborations that strengthen Hive’s ecosystem and customer value.
* Accelerate discovery efforts in the Video Analytics product area by coaching and supporting the dedicated Product Manager
* Continuously raise the bar for product practices across the Hive Product Office and foster a culture of learning, data-informed decision-making, and shared ownership.

**More details:**


* Role type: Full-time with a standard probation period
* Start date: February 2026
* Working hours: Align with CET (Central European Time)
* Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Hybrid: ± 2 days/week in the office, with occasional trips to Berlin where the Engineering team is based)

*Just a heads up,* *we're a dog-friendly office!*

### **Who we are looking for**

We're looking for someone with a strong product background, but just as importantly, the right attitude. At Hive, how you work is just as valuable as what you know. We also don’t expect you to tick every box. If you’re excited about this role and ready to learn, we’d love to hear from you!


**We are looking for someone with:**


* Extensive product management experience (around 7+ years), ideally in B2B software, enterprise video, networking, or software partnerships.
* Proven success leading complex, technical product areas with multiple integrations and dependencies across systems.
* Confident with outcome-driven, customer-centric product discovery and delivery practices, with proven ability to coach and elevate product practices across product communities.
* A foundational understanding of enterprise network architectures, routing, and security impacts.
* A systems thinker with analytical depth, who enjoys shaping long-term product direction and navigating change.
* Excellent communicator who builds trust across functions and geographies.
* Collaborative bridge-builder, who connects technical depth with business outcomes and communicates with clarity and impact to diverse stakeholders.
* Curious learner with a growth mindset, who enables others and turns challenges into opportunities for development.
* Values-driven contributor, who embodies Hive’s principles of innovation, customer centricity, and empowerment, while leading with humility, curiosity, and purpose.

### **Why join Hive?**

* Global Impact: Partner with 150 of the world’s largest enterprises, helping them achieve alignment and measurable success through live video.
* Dynamic, Product-Driven Culture: Join a collaborative, inclusive, and diverse environment that values curiosity, continuous learning, and new perspectives.
* Empowered Leadership: Play a pivotal role in shaping Hive’s future while connecting directly with the customers who rely on our solutions.
* Pioneering Innovation: Be at the forefront of building strategic communication tools that empower enterprises to thrive amidst massive change.
* Great Benefits: Wellness stipend, pension, health insurance, extra vacation days, benefit bikes, and more!
* Flexibility: We value flexibility and trust. Whether you’re balancing personal commitments or exploring new ideas, you’ll find support and autonomy here with flexible working hours and a hybrid work model.

### **Recruitment process: what to expect**

To apply, please submit your CV and answer a few short questions in lieu of a cover letter directly in the application form. Please submit all documents in English. Please submit applications by December 1st.


Our hiring process is designed to be transparent and collaborative:


* **Intro call**: Meet our People & Talent Partner and share more about your motivation.
* **Hiring Manager interview:** Meet our CPO to discuss your product management journey.
* **Product development case:** Collaborate on a relevant challenge together with your Product and Engineering peers.
* **Culture interview**: Meet one of our Hive Culture Ambassadors to align on values and vision.
* **Reference checks:** We take security seriously and conduct two reference checks as part of our compliance with internal and regulatory requirements.
* **Decision**: Timely feedback and next steps - our goal is to complete the process within around 4 weeks, depending on your availability.

title: Senior Backend Software Engineer - TypeScript, NodeJS/NestJS
description:
**Assignment description**


For our client we are looking for a **Senior Backend Software Engineer - TypeScript, NodeJS/NestJS, React.**

**Description:**  

Consists of team members who are backend developers, front end developers, testers, product owners and scrum master. They have all the competencies in the team to take an idea to development, deploy to production as well as maintain over time. Their ambition is to support the dealer and owner of a machine peace of mind, from an uptime as well as productivity perspective.


They are now looking for a senior developer with excellent analytical skills, great at problem-solving, passionate about technology and who loves developing software applications!


They are looking for you who ensure that you understand how your work is adding value to their customers and are not limited to take on development tasks but also willing to chip in were needed.  

In this team they are curious about everything at work and have a “can do” attitude solving their challenges together, making sure to complete each sprint as planned. They would like their new colleague to have this curiosity, drive and being a team player.
  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop software applications in Type script, using NestJS for our backend development and React for our frontend.
* Work closely and collaborative around UX & design
* Recommend technical solutions based on the understanding of the business and the user flow as well as architecture
* Deploy, operate and maintain our applications including driving continuous improvement for better quality, functionality and cost effectiveness.
* Taking lead in DevOps responsibility based on the schedule which will rotate amongst all developers
* Present/demo solutions to a larger audience
* Coaching mindset, can coach and be coached by peers

 **Competence Profile and Qualifications:**

* Track record of being a team player who make commitments and deliver on them
* A University degree in software engineering, computer science or similar education
* Minimum 7 Years’ Experience as Application Developer and or Architect
* Senior in TypeScript, React and NestJS
* Experience from working with query languages such as GraphQL.
* Experience from working with test frameworks (Jest, Cypress) and test automation.
* Great communication skills, both verbal and written
* Fluent in English - both written and spoken
* Experience working with Azure
* Valid work-permit for Sweden, if not EU-citizen
* If you are fluent in Swedish this is beneficial

  

**Start date: 2026-12-01**

**End date: 2026-12-31**

**Required skills**

GraphQL , Nodejs , React ,Azure , Valid work-permit for Sweden, if not EU-citizen Communication skills , Typescript , cypress, NestJS , Devops, Test Automation

**Languages** English(Proficient) Swedish(Beginner)  

  

**Application Deadline-16th Nov**

title: System Architect - Anesthesia
description:
System Architect - Anesthesia


**Date:** Nov 7, 2025
**Location:**Stockholm, SE
**Company:** Maquet Critical Care AB
**Remote Work:** 1-2 days at home (site based)  

**With a passion for life**  


Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.  



Join Getinge and strengthen our Product Area Critical Care in Solna as a System Architect. We are now strengthening one of our value creation teams to speed up the software development. You will, together with the team, be responsible for and own the whole product development cycle. The work consists of new development, from concepts and requirements to final product. The team is responsible for core subsystems development related to gas delivery, connectivity, Cyber Security, alarm and monitoring both for new products together with maintenance of our existing products within anesthesia.  



As a System Architect at Getinge, you will tackle complex interdisciplinary challenges and collaborate with highly skilled colleagues to find innovative solutions. You will contribute to the development of world-leading products in intensive care and anesthesia.  


**What you will do**

Your primary responsibility as a System Architect is to drive and take part in the system engineering of our products and ensure that they deliver the required system functionality and performance. This includes activities like system design, requirements engineering, and risk management. Strong documentation skills are essential to secure clear scope, right expectations, and formal requirements, to enable efficient collaboration and development. Risk analysis plays a crucial role in addressing challenges and maintaining the highest quality standards.  


**To excel in this role, you should possess the following qualities:**
* Experience as a System Architect, ideally within the medical technology or related regulated field.
* Experience working with Cyber Security
* Comfortable making critical technical decisions, thriving in high-expectation environments.
* Interest in advanced healthcare and our products in intensive care and anesthesiology.
* Customer-centric mindset, collaborating closely with customers and users to understand their needs through user studies and evaluations.
* Effective collaboration within cross-functional teams, including product managers, UX-designers, developers, and testers.
* Thrive when working with safety-critical systems in advanced healthcare, where functionality and reliability are vital.
* Proactive and self-driven in learning and contributing to the continued development of our products and our organizations capabilities.

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Bachelor or Master of Science in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering, or equivalent.
* 5 years of experience as a System Architect.
* Experience designing/developing complex mechatronic systems with graphical user interface.
* Risk analysis expertise, addressing potential challenges, and maintaining high-quality standards.
* Experience of requirement and test management software
* Experience with product development in a regulated industry, e.g. medical technology or automotive.
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.

  


**Personal Characteristics:**

In addition to technical skills, the following personal attributes will contribute to your success:  


* Analytical and systematic problem-solving approach, capable of handling intricate challenges and breaking down tasks effectively.
* Proactive and assertive, leading technology and driving towards common goals
* Ambition for growth, embracing challenging and stimulating tasks.
* Strong documentation skills

  



Become part of Getinge's revolution in healthcare technology. Apply now to embark on a rewarding journey with us.  


**Why join Getinge**

Getinge offers a job in a safe and informal work environment, where we appreciate close team collaboration. We keep an open dialogue between leaders and employees, as well as between teams. We are focused on developing people, and together we will create a plan for learning and competence development when you start your career with us.  



We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, including wellness allowances, generous family benefits and joint company activities. Everything to ensure we support your well-being and goals.  


**Application**

Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible.

We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.  



If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Katarina Dahlén at Katarina.dahlen@getinge.com or Recruiter Sofia Ekstrand at sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com  



We look forward to receiving your application. We hope you will join us on our journey to become the world’s most desired MedTech company.  


**About us**With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

#LI-SE1
company_description: Getinge is a global leading supplier of innovative medtech products and solutions within healthcare and life science.

title: Product Designer - Kids shoes
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced Kids Shoe Designer with a strong creative eye, attention to finer detail and fashion sensibility to join us at H&M's head office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 You will be part of a fast-paced environment and work with youthful, elevated fashion products that welcome everyone! This role is designing across both Boys and Girls from Newborn, Baby, Child and Teenager.
   

  

 As a Product Specialist, you'll drive and identify key products, translating them into commercial collections. You should have strong design process skills and be able to communicate your vision clearly with a creative, fashion-forward focus.
   

  

**Who You’ll Work With**
 You'll collaborate with a team to provide diverse markets with the best products sold worldwide through H&M's omni channels. Your handwriting will demonstrate a strong fashion trend awareness and genuine passion for shoes! Maintaining a high fashion sense for style and trends for the target customer, while being cost-conscious throughout the design process, is essential. The role demands high energy, creativity, and experience in coaching and leading others to commercial success!
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
* BA/MA or equivalent experience in Fashion Footwear/Product Design
* Minimum of 4 years’ work experience as a Designer with a strength in overall collection building
* High knowledge of materials, technical details, and processes of footwear
* A visionary mindset with true passion for women’s fashion, current and future trends
* A strong customer focus and commercial mindset for the H&M customer
* Experience working with suppliers/factories in Asia and Europe
* Skilled in working in Adobe Creative Suite programs
* 3D is meriting
* Demonstrated communication skills and true collaborative team player
* Leadership and coaching mindset
* Independent and proactive approach
* Able to set priorities with an organized & structured approach
* Flexible mindset and adaptable to changes in a fast moving & growing industry
* Fluent in English (Swedish not necessary)


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

 All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here
 *In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are. Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 If this sounds interesting and you fit the qualifications,
 **apply asap with CV and design portfolio** 
 (pdf max 10mb/uploading). Assessments will start immediately.
   

  

 All documents should be in English. This is a full time permanent position starting as soon as possible at our H&M Head office in Stockholm, Sweden working on site.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Senior UX/Product Designer
description:
****About The Role:****
 We are seeking a
 **UX/Product Designer** 
 to join our team in Stockholm. This is an exciting opportunity to directly influence the evolution of our market-leading enterprise applications.
   

  

 As a member of our central design team, you will champion user-centred design and play a vital role in enhancing the overall product experience for our users. You will work closely with various product teams, with your project focus and responsibilities varying over time.
   

  

**Why Join the OSTTRA UX Team?**
 You'll join our experienced in-house UX team of 10 designers with expertise across the full spectrum of Design and UX. Our designers are centred in Stockholm, but we have colleagues across the globe that we collaborate with daily.
   

  

 Our UX team is involved in shaping new concepts and products, as well as strategically refining existing designs. This position involves close collaboration with Business stakeholders, Product Managers, fellow UX designers, and developers. The goal is to make impactful and thoughtful design choices that help our organisation deliver the best possible user experiences.
   

  

**The Challenge**
 Our products are complex enterprise systems, which require a thoughtful and strategic approach to design and UX. The role does not require prior experience with similar services, but you need to be comfortable designing for complex data structures and expert users.
   

  

 We leverage a well-established and continuously evolving design system to guide designers and developers toward visually cohesive and consistent solutions. Your experience will also be key in the ongoing growth and refinement of this system.
   

  

**Who Are You?**
 You have a pragmatic design mindset, seeing design as a powerful tool that drives tangible business value, extending beyond just aesthetics and usability. You are a dedicated professional with a strong interest in the intersection of business strategy and user experience. You are passionate about translating complex business ideas and user needs into impactful products that deliver genuine user value. Given that many of our products are data-intensive, you are comfortable with the challenge of tackling data visualisation and establishing clear information hierarchies.
   

  

****Requirements****
* 5+ years experience in UX design and Product Design.
* Experience designing for complex applications and intricate data structures.
* Hands-on experience in creating a wide range of UX deliverables, including wireframes, prototypes, and user flows.
* Expert in Figma.
* Strong visual design skills and problem-solving abilities.
* Proficient in English.
* A strong interest in workshopping and user research is a significant plus, though you will be supported by experienced colleagues in this area.
* Portfolio submission is mandatory as part of the application. You will have the opportunity to present and elaborate on your work during the interview process.


****About OSTTRA****
 We bring together four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for more than 25 years: TriOptima, MarkitServ, Traiana & Reset.
   

  

 Together, we play a critical role in supporting global financial markets, connecting thousands of counterparties on our multi-asset networks that underpin the post trade lifecycle from trade capture, through portfolio optimisation, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Our founding companies were all pioneers in their field, partnering with the industry to automate and optimise post-trade workflows and fundamentally improve the way Capital Markets operate, each emerging as a class-leading solutions provider.
   

  

 To our clients, we provide end-to-end services to ensure all post-trade activities are processed and optimised seamlessly, offering outstanding connectivity, innovative solutions and an unrivalled depth of expertise across capital markets workflows.
   

  

 To our teams, we offer a company and culture that is collaborative, respectful and inclusive to all. We connect our community, strengthen our specialisms and champion our uniqueness, so everyone is confident, comfortable, and proud to join in and stand out.
   

  

****About OSTTRA****
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
****Benefits:****
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include:**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

****Recruitment Fraud Alert:****
 If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf

title: Product Lead, MarTech
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced Product Lead to drive the vision, strategy, and execution of our Marketing Technology product area at Wolt. This role sits at the intersection of growth marketing, automation, and data, enabling our User Acquisition (UA) and CRM marketing teams to scale and automate efficiently, target intelligently and measure impact precisely across our paid marketing and consumer-facing CRM campaigns.
   

  

 As a Product Lead in MarTech, you will lead a cross-functional team of engineers, data scientists, and designers to build the tools, systems, and platforms that power paid marketing and CRM at scale. You’ll define and drive the product vision and roadmap for the MarTech team, ensuring alignment with business and growth goals. Your work will involve translating complex growth challenges into clear product bets that deliver measurable results across new user growth, engagement, retention, and customer lifetime value, while improving campaign efficiencies. You’ll also drive advancements in audience segmentation, targeting, attribution, campaign automation, and sophisticated marketing measurement systems that enable marketing teams to operate faster and smarter. In close collaboration with data and privacy teams, you’ll ensure that all marketing data, events, and measurement systems are accurate, privacy-compliant, and scalable.
   

  

 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* Extensive experience in product management, with a strong track record in growth, marketing tech, ads, or data platforms.
* Deep understanding of digital marketing, CRM, attribution, and experimentation - you know how marketers think and how tech can help them move faster.
* Experience leading cross-functional platform initiatives with multiple stakeholders and complex dependencies.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, you can rally teams and partners around a shared vision.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, design sensitivity, and business savviness with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO".


 Next steps
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Business Analyst within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.*
**The position**
 We are looking for a Business Analyst who will work in the R&D EHR Medication Team responsible for the medication module in the electronic healthcare record COSMIC. The medication module supports the prescription and administration of all drugs, vaccines, nutrition’s etc. for inpatients as well as outpatients. One of our current initiatives is to align our solutions to the “Nationella läkemedelslistan” which will provide a unified, up-to-date overview of a patient’s e-prescribed medications, improving safety, coordination, and quality of care across Sweden’s healthcare system.
   

  

 As a Business Analyst, you will be a part of an agile development team, including developers and testers. You will also collaborate closely with product owner(s), other business analysts, informaticians, architects, and UX designers. You will investigate and analyse needs, detail requirements, and design solutions for one of Sweden’s leading healthcare journal systems. You are an important link between the developers and the customer, with the mission to understand the needs of our end users and translate them into technical solutions. You often get to follow an initiative all the way from pre-study to development and implementation at the customer's premises. As part of our team, you will do meaningful work where you help to improve and digitize healthcare processes.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**We Offer**
* A strong team spirit with many team ceremonies, both at the office and online
* Being a driver in Swedish e-health innovation by designing nationally and internationally used solutions and standards
* Special interest groups and guilds where you can explore interests and evolve personally and professionally
* An international network with close colleagues in both Sweden and Sri Lanka


**About You**
 You work independently and with your own drive, but also thrive when you get the opportunity to collaborate with your teammates, other Business Analysts, as well as other roles across the organization. You like to meet our customers, partners and eHealth organizations and are passionate about finding the best solutions. We believe that you are analytical, well-structured and with strong cooperation skills.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Minimum 3 years of working with business analysis, requirement analysis, product design or similar.
* Great knowledge in how business needs can be translated into software requirements.
* Great ability to collaborate with product owner(s), architects, system developers and UX designers.
* Comfortable using AI tools and eager to explore how they can enhance requirement work.
* Communicates fluently in English and Swedish.


**It's a bonus if you have**
* Previously worked within healthcare or have experience of COSMIC
* Experience in health informatics and familiarity with healthcare standards and specifications such as FHIR, OpenEHR, and SNOMED CT
* Experience of UX design


**Place of employment:** 
 Linköping or Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.

 Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden. We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Learn more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: User Research Director
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 At Mentimeter, we believe the future of leadership starts with curiosity. As our User Research Director, you will lead the next evolution of how we understand, design for, and empower millions of users worldwide. This is a rare opportunity to build a truly strategic research function that not only studies user behavior but directly shapes how organizations learn, communicate, and make decisions.
   

  

 You will join a product company where the aim is for insights to fuel everything from product bets to long-term strategy, and where your work will help leaders, educators and facilitators around the world listen better, collaborate smarter, and turn passive audiences into active participants. Reporting to the VP Design and as part of the Design Leadership Team, you will shape how Mentimeter turns insight into impact across the entire product experience.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for a modern research leader who can scale practice, shape strategy, and inspire teams across disciplines. Someone who thrives at the intersection of evidence, design, and technology, turning complexity into clarity and insight into impact.
   

  

 You have likely built and led high-performing user research teams in fast-moving product environments, and you know how to balance rigor with speed. You are as comfortable defining a long-term insights agenda as you are jumping into a study yourself. Most of all, you believe research should not only inform decisions but accelerate them.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Define and own the user research agenda: Shape a proactive, company-wide view of the questions that matter most and ensure we have the evidence to answer them.
* Scale ResearchOps: Build the systems, processes, and infrastructure that make user research efficient, repeatable, and continuously compounding. Create frameworks that make insights easy to access, reuse, and activate across teams, ensuring research becomes a shared capability that grows in value over time.
* Advance mixed-method practice: Establish a mixed-method insights framework that combines behavioral data with qualitative understanding to tell the full story of our users.
* Embed insight where work happens: Operationalize user journey insights directly within product and design workflows, making them visible where decisions happen.
* Span product and service: Develop an integrated perspective that connects product experience with service delivery into a single view of the users.
* Develop the craft and team: Recruit, coach, and grow a strong user research team that operates collaboratively across product, design, engineering, and commercial.
* Influence at strategic level: Translate insights into clear recommendations that shape priorities, roadmaps, and company bets.
* Evolve practice through technology: Push the boundaries of user research by integrating emerging technologies like AI and automation to scale insight generation and continuously raise the standard of practice.


**Requirements**
* 8+ years of proven experience leading user research in fast-moving, product-led organisations.
* Collaborative leadership style, skilled at building trust across disciplines.
* Deep knowledge across multiple research methodologies, with the ability to align and integrate them effectively.
* Track record of influencing senior leaders and shaping product and service strategy through evidence-based recommendations.
* Exceptional communication and storytelling skills.
* Future-oriented mindset, committed to advancing the craft and experimenting with new approaches.
* Strong grounding in building scalable user research operations and infrastructure.
* Practical expertise in applying AI and automation to user research workflows.


**Not Required**
 You don’t have to know Swedish. Daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 50 nationalities!
   

  

**Location**
 This is primarily an on-site role at Mentimeter HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Product Design Lead – AI Assistant & Conversational UX(Bangkok - Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**This role is BANGKOK-BASED, RELOCATION PROVIDED.**
**Get to Know Our Design Team:**
 The Design team is a diverse group of product designers and researchers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok. Being a product-driven company, we constantly partner with product managers and engineers to understand user problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces.
   

  

 This is a great time to join a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy.
   

  

 There’s always room to grow here. As a Product Design Lead, you can deepen your craft through complex problem-solving and systems thinking, or expand your leadership by mentoring others, driving strategy, and leading cross-functional initiatives. This is a great time to join a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy.
   

  

 We’re building the next generation of AI-powered travel experiences, and conversational UX is central to that vision. Join our design team to help shape how users engage with intelligent travel assistants, real-time chat, and natural language interfaces across platforms.
   

  

**The Role**
 We’re looking for a Product Design Lead to join our AI Assistant team and shape the future of conversational travel experiences. This hybrid role blends hands-on product design with light team leadership, managing a small group of 2–3 talented designers.
   

  

 You’ll lead the UX strategy for AI-powered interactions like smart chat, trip planning, support automation, and contextual travel recommendations. You’ll also mentor designers, collaborate closely with product and engineering, and help evolve our design culture across the organisation.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
**Design & Execution**
* Lead the end-to-end design of AI and chat-based experiences across web and app.
* Translate complex AI capabilities into clear, helpful user flows and intuitive interfaces.
* Create prototypes and flows that balance clarity, trust, and speed for our users.
* Drive UX and visual design quality within your scope, while aligning with Agoda’s broader vision.
* Partner with Design Leadership, Product managers, Engineers, Researchers, Analysts and Content designers to shape what we build and how we build it.
* Use data-driven insights, research, and industry best practices to align on design direction.


**Leadership & People**
* Manage and mentor a small team of 2–3 designers, focusing on growth and creativity.
* Provide regular feedback, run critiques, and support career development.
* Help scale design culture, systems, and quality through org-wide design initiatives.
* Act as a thought partner to senior stakeholders across Product, Data Science, and Engineering.


**What You’ll Bring**
* 7+ years of experience in product or interaction design, with proven hands-on craft.
* Experience designing for conversational interfaces, chatbots, or AI-powered systems.
* A strong portfolio showing user-centered thinking and high-quality execution.
* Ability to simplify complexity through clear information architecture and interaction flows.
* Experience leading design discussions and collaborating cross-functionally.
* Mentorship or light people management experience is a plus.
* Familiarity with LLMs, natural language UX, or multimodal interactions is a bonus.
* A data-informed mindset with experience using research, analytics, and best practices to guide design decisions and validate ideas with cross-functional teams.


**Bonus Points**
* Background in voice UX, multimodal interfaces, or customer support tools
* Experience with localisation and designing for multilingual audiences
* Familiarity with personalisation engines or recommendation systems
* Prior experience in travel, e-commerce, or large-scale B2C platforms


**Why This Role**
 This is a rare chance to combine craft leadership and small-team management in a high-impact AI product area. You’ll influence the direction of a new travel paradigm and shape the conversational layer that connects users to Agoda’s entire ecosystem, from search to support to inspiration.
   

  

 Join us to help build the next generation of AI-powered travel experiences.
