title: Customer Success Manager, Core/ Platform - Nordics
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*
 Job Category
   

  

 Customer Success
   

  

 Job Details
   

  

**About Salesforce**
 Salesforce is the #1 AI CRM, where humans with agents drive customer success together. Here, ambition meets action. Tech meets trust. And innovation isn’t a buzzword — it’s a way of life. The world of work as we know it is changing and we're looking for Trailblazers who are passionate about bettering business and the world through AI, driving innovation, and keeping Salesforce's core values at the heart of it all.
   

  

 Ready to level-up your career at the company leading workforce transformation in the agentic era? You’re in the right place! Agentforce is the future of AI, and you are the future of Salesforce.
   

  

 At Salesforce, customers who choose our Signature Success Plan unlock our most elite level of partnership — expert guidance, deep product knowledge, and proactive support to stay agile and maximize value. As a Customer Success Manager (CSM) for Signature Success, you will become a strategic partner to our most important customers, serving as their trusted advisor and orchestrating the full Signature experience.
   

  

**Role Description**
 You will proactively set the customer up for success through optimization of the solution, with special care during critically important peak events. This will require technical knowledge of Salesforce Clouds, and the ability to work closely across internal and external teams to provide a unified Signature experience. As a Customer Success Manager, you will be a named advisor to a portfolio of Signature Success customers in Nordics. You will build deep, trusted relationships with customer stakeholders and Salesforce account teams, maintaining a high level of awareness of customer priorities, business goals, and potential risks.
   

  

 You will proactively guide your customers to success by aligning their business goals with the Salesforce platform, offering strategic and solution recommendations, coordinating Signature Success deliverables, and ensuring operational excellence during critical events. You will also support communication during major incidents, providing timely updates and managing customer expectations.
   

  

**Your Impact**
*Strategic Partnership*
* Act as the trusted point of contact and advocate for your customers, driving alignment between their business goals and Salesforce’s capabilities.
* Build and sustain relationships with customer IT and business executives, becoming a true strategic partner.


*Customer Enablement*
* Guide customers in adopting the Salesforce platform through proactive recommendations and personalized service delivery from the Signature catalogue.
* Provide insight into new features and releases, helping customers navigate change and mitigate potential risks.


*Incident Management*
* Support communications during high-severity incidents, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience while advocating for customer resolution.


*Renewal & Growth*
* Clearly articulate and demonstrate the value of Signature Success and platform capabilities to ensure ongoing investment and expansion.


**Minimum Requirements**
* 6+ years of experience in Cloud environments in roles such as Customer Success, SaaS platform management, Solution Architecture, or Technical Consulting
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills with demonstrated ability to communicate and influence optimally at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level.
* Skills for analyzing technical concepts, translating them into business terms and mapping business requirements into technical features.
* Ability to explain sophisticated technical concepts in business-friendly terms to customers, then explain customer needs to internal partners.
* Experience leading efforts of cross-functional teams to facilitate the resolution or disposition of customer needs or projects.
* Proven ability to build trust-based relationships and navigate complex, enterprise-level environments


**Preferred Requirements**
* Experience with the Salesforce Core platform is a plus
* Salesforce product certifications are a plus
* Knowledge of Salesforce products and features, capabilities, best use, and how to deploy.
* Experience working with Enterprise-level customers.a


 Unleash Your Potential
   

  

 When you join Salesforce, you’ll be limitless in all areas of your life. Our benefits and resources support you to find balance and
 *be your best* 
 , and our AI agents accelerate your impact so you can
 *do your best* 
 . Together, we’ll bring the power of Agentforce to organizations of all sizes and deliver amazing experiences that customers love. Apply today to not only shape the future — but to redefine what’s possible — for yourself, for AI, and the world.
   

  

 Accommodations
   

  

 If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.
   

  

 Posting Statement
   

  

 Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

title: 🚀 Sales Development Representative (SDR) till Bepp
description:
Bepp är ett svenskt B2B SaaS-bolag som gör kvalitets- och förbättringsarbete
 **enkelt, engagerande och lönsamt** 
 . Vi hjälper en traditionell målgrupp att ta klivet in i AI-eran, utan krångliga system, långa implementationer eller dyra konsulter.
 



 Vi lanserade hösten 2025 och har vuxit snabbt (0 → 500 000 SEK ARR på 3 månader). Nu vill vi gasa ännu mer och söker därför
 **vår första SDR** 
 , en nyckelperson i att bygga vårt säljmaskineri från grunden.
   





**Rollen -** 
**Sales Development Representative (SDR)** 




 Som SDR blir du motorn i vår leadgenerering och den första kontakten många framtida kunder kommer ha med Bepp. Du kommer arbeta tätt tillsammans med våra grundare, Nils och Ian, och vara med och forma hur modern prospektering och outreach ska fungera i ett AI-first SaaS-bolag.
 



 Det här är en roll för dig som gillar tempo, tydliga resultat och sociala interaktioner – och som vill växa snabbt inom B2B-försäljning.
   





**Du kommer framför allt att:** 



* Identifiera och prospektera potentiella kunder
* Skapa och kvalificera leads via telefon, mail, LinkedIn och smarta AI-verktyg
* Boka demos och möten åt vårt säljteam (till en början: åt Nils)
* Bygga relationer tidigt i kundresan
* Testa och förbättra vår outreach-playbook
* Arbeta nära marknad & produkt för att fånga upp signaler från marknaden



**Vi ser gärna att du:** 



* Trivs i en snabb, entreprenöriell miljö
* Gillar att prata med människor och vågar ta första kontakten
* Är driven, nyfiken och lär dig snabbt
* Är strukturerad och gillar att nå (och slå) mål
* Har 1–3 års erfarenhet av B2B-prospektering/sälj
* Drivs av att utvecklas och vill växa vidare till AE på sikt



**Vad du får:** 



* En central roll i att bygga Bepps säljorganisation från dag 1
* Möjlighet att växa snabbt – både kompetensmässigt och i ansvar
* Lön + provision + möjlighet till optioner
* En startupmiljö där beslutsvägar är korta och dagarna varierande
* Modern teknikstack och AI-verktyg som gör jobbet roligare och effektivare
* Ett team som är extremt dedikerat till att bygga något stort, enkelt och smart



 📍 Plats: Stockholm (L26)
 



 ⏱️ Omfattning: Heltid
 



  





 Är du nyfiken? Hör av dig! Vi berättar gärna mer. Viktigast för oss är att hitta en riktigt bra match – för både dig och oss.
 



  





 Let’s talk!
 



 Nils Pettersson & Ian Thorslund

title: Part-Time Customer Support Specialist (3 Days per week, Contract, Swedish speaking)
description:
At Cision, we believe in empowering every individual to make an impact. Here, your voice is heard, your ideas are valued, and your unique perspective fuels our collective success. As part of our global team, you'll thrive in an environment that champions curiosity, collaboration, and innovation, all while making meaningful contributions to the brands we accelerate.
   

  

 Join us in shaping the future of communication and building authentic connections that matter. Whether you're solving complex problems or driving bold innovations, your growth is our success, and together, we’ll create the conversations of tomorrow.
   

  

**Empower your impact at Cision. Be seen, be understood, be you.**
 As a Customer Support Specialist, reporting into Support Management, you are working within the boundaries of 1st tier support, while in close collaboration with Technical Product Specialists, Customer Experience and our fantastic R&D team.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* Reply to customer inquiries via supported communication channels
* Identify, replicate, and report validated product issues to the R&D team
* Identify and log feature requests
* Follow-up on customer inquiries upon issue resolution/feedback from R&D
* Provide outstanding service to our customers via prompt and value-adding interactions over phone, email and chat
* Take ownership of support tickets and be responsible for funnelling them through all process stages until a resolution has been reached
* Maintain an overview of submitted cases to R&D, and flag internal SLA breaches
* Escalate support cases based on severity levels and associated business risk assessments
* Be an expert on the Cision product suite and its features as they are launched and engage in feature tests
* Update internal knowledge base with new relevant insights to enhance knowledge sharing across all support team members
* Participate and contribute to roundtables, calibration and training sessions within support and cross-functional departments


**Minimum Required Qualifications**
* Excellent Swedish and English language skills, written and verbal
* Highly customer focused; shows a real passion for the customer experience and customer support industry
* Driven, self-starter, enthusiastic and with an “ownership” mentality
* Adaptable and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment
* Able to prioritise workload in line with customer demand
* Proven experience in a customer-interacting role
* Ability to collaborate with internal and external partners whilst coordinating key customer deliverables, ensuring world class customer experience
* Advanced listening and verbal communication skills to understand customer's needs, and ability to respond clearly and concisely both verbally and written
* Enthusiast; strong work ethic with a positive mindset, and can-do attitude
* Influencing and negotiation skills
* Team player that appreciates working together for a common goal
* Working knowledge of MS Office Suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint is required


 As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire, a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.
   

  

 Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com.
   

  

 Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.
   

  

 Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com
   

  

 Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

title: Director, Sales - Public Sector
description:
**Company Description**
 It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.
   

  

**Job Description**
**What you get to do in this role:**
* Build a team of direct Sales Executives to drive rapid new business sales growth within Public Sector in the region
* Build and drive sales strategy for the region in conjunction with Sales Operations to effectively Go-To-Market including understanding the competitive landscape, presence and strength within the region
* Actively engage in territory planning, relationship development and opportunity development and driving revenue by supporting and assisting Field Sales Teams in closing opportunities
* Recruit, coach and mentor team members to drive excellence
* Development of territories and quota for the sales team and effectively communicate to set performance expectations within the team
* Manage and report accurate forecast and pipeline to the business
* Achievement of annual sales goals on a quarterly and annual basis is required
* Engage and align effectively in C-level meetings in order to properly understand customer business requirements
* Build effective working relationships with Solution Consulting, Business Units, Professional Services, Marketing, our Partner community and the ServiceNow executive team
* Retain and grow existing customer base with regular non-sales customer engagement activities to deliver an excellent customer experience


**Qualifications**
**To be successful in this role you have:**
* Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry.
* Extensive track record of new business sales success including presentation and negotiation skills within Public Sector and at C Level
* Strong success in recruiting, coaching and managing an exceptional sales team
* Strong strategic thinking including analytical and financial planning skills to meet and exceed quotas and goals.
* Ownership of accurate CRM reports including current and future quarterly forecasts and opportunity inspection
* Experienced in driving sales process and drive effective working relationships with Sales Operations
* Ability to understand the 'bigger picture' and business drivers around IT
* Ability to build long term strategic and senior level relationships
* Ability to adapt and work effectively within a rapidly changing and growing environment
* Demonstrates strong business and financial acumen
* Built self-motivated sales teams that embrace a culture of collaboration, enthusiasm, and overachievement
* Champions and promotes top performers, constantly develops and coaches the team and themselves, and topgrades appropriately
* Proven partner relationships and networks, and ability to grow the impact of revenue streams and territory development through the partner ecosystem
* Ownership of driving successful pipeline generation activities developed by marketing or the partner community
* Fluency in English and Swedish


 Additional Information
   

  

**Work Personas**
 We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.
   

  

**Accommodations**
 We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.
   

  

**Export Control Regulations**
 For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.
   

  

 From Fortune. ©2025 Fortune Media IP Limited. All rights reserved. Used under license.

title: Lösningsarkitekt  BI
description:
Lösningsarkitekt BI
   

  

 Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du en passionerad lösningsarkitekt inom Data & Analytics? Vill du vara en del av ett dynamiskt och innovativt team som arbetar med den senaste tekniken? Då är Data Insight-teamet på CGI i Stockholm rätt plats för dig!
   

  

 Vi befinner oss i ett expansivt skede och söker nu en driven kollega som vill vara med på vår spännande resa.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta hands-on med en bred variation av uppgifter, från traditionell data warehouse-utveckling till avancerad analys och arkitekturfrågor. Hos oss kommer kunna komma att:
   

  

* Ansvara för leveranser och leda projekt från start till mål
* Arbeta nära våra kunder i en rådgivande roll och hjälpa dem att nå sina affärsmål
* Samarbeta med ett engagerat team och stora erkända partners som Microsoft, Databricks och Snowflake


 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö med fokus på innovation och utveckling
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt
* Stora möjligheter till personlig och professionell utveckling
* Ett starkt och stöttande team som värdesätter samarbete och kunskapsdelning
* Coachande mindset och inkluderar dina framtida kollegor och kunder i att tillsammans bli vassare
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden och balans mellan arbete och privatliv


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Vilja och driv att vara med och scopa projekt och ta fram lösningsförslag till våra kunder
* Arbetat med data- och molnlösningar Azure, Databricks, dbt, Power BI / Fabric
* Gedigen erfarenhet av datamodellering samt SQL och Python
* Erfarenhet av att bearbeta data inom en data warehouse/ lakehouse -miljö
* Erfarenhet av att fånga krav och omsätta dem i lösningar
* Minst 12 års erfarenhet inom analytics
* Konsultbakgrund
* Vi förutsätter att du behärskar svenska och engelska väl i både tal och skrift.


 Det är också meriterande om du har:
   

  

* En högskoleexamen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller civilingenjörsexamen
* Bedrivit och lett arbete enligt agila metoder


**Vem är du?**
 Du är en person som delar med dig av din kunskap, är ödmjuk och lätt att samarbeta med. Du kan hantera många bollar i luften samtidigt och tar egna initiativ. Du är självgående, utåtriktad och affärsmässig, och du brinner för att arbeta med både människor och teknik.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Du är välkommen att ställa eventuella frågor till Christian Carlborg, Director Consulting Services, via e-post: christian.carlborg@cgi.com.
   

  

**CGI**
 På CGI drivs vi av insikter där vi levererar kompletta, skalbara och hållbara IT- och affärstjänster som utformas globalt och levereras lokalt. Vi strävar efter att arbeta nära våra kunder, detta genom djup branschkunskap och en förståelse för kundens utmaningar.
   

  

 Kombinationen av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder och innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: AI Lösningsarkitekt
description:
*Vill du vara med och bygga morgondagens AI-lösningar som gör skillnad för hela Länsförsäkringar? Vi söker nu en AI-arkitekt som vill ta en nyckelroll i vår satsning på att utveckla och förvalta innovativa AI-system. Hos oss får du arbeta nära både verksamhet och IT, och vara med och skapa en säker, ansvarsfull och skalbar AI-plattform som stöttar hela vår affär.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som AI-arkitekt hos oss blir du en central spelare i vår förändringsresa mot att bygga upp kompetens och förmåga inom Data & AI. Du kommer att vara med och forma hur vi använder AI i hela organisationen, från strategi till implementering, och bidra till att våra AI-initiativ går hand i hand med Länsförsäkringars övergripande mål.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Utforma arkitektur och lösningar för AI/ML inom vår Data & AI-ekosystem
* Samarbeta med affär, IT och data för att bygga och skala AI-baserade system
* Designa molnarkitektur för AI och data samt driva innovation i hela organisationen
* Stötta team och medarbetare i att bygga kompetens inom AI/ML
* Bidra till att teknik och strategi går i takt med företagets mål
* Företräda AI-initiativ både internt och externt


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av mjukvaru- eller lösningsarkitektur, samt vana att leverera AI/ML-lösningar i produktion
* Gedigen kunskap inom molnarkitektur (AWS, Azure eller GCP) och erfarenhet av att designa AI-workloads
* Erfarenhet av MLOps och ML-plattformar, inklusive datapipelines, modellcykel, CI/CD och övervakning
* Förståelse för Generativ AI och LLMs, inklusive prompting och prototypframtagning
* Bakgrund inom SaaS, mikrotjänster och API:er kopplat till AI-integration
* Förmåga att kommunicera effektivt med både ledning och tekniska team
* Kunskap om säkerhet, dataskydd och regelverk som AI Act och GDPR


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av agentbaserad AI och orkestreringsramverk
* Kännedom om LangChain, LLMOps, vector search/RAG och retrieval pipelines
* Kunskap om Responsible AI och hur man bygger tillit och transparens i AI-lösningar
* Branscherfarenhet från finans eller försäkring
* Certifieringar inom moln, dataplattformar eller arkitektur


 Som person är du nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och har lätt för att se helheten. Du trivs med att arbeta i en föränderlig miljö och har en stark vilja att driva utveckling framåt. Du är kommunikativ, samarbetsinriktad och har förmågan att inspirera och engagera andra i förändringsarbete.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi står inför en omfattande utveckling inom data och AI – ett initiativ som kommer att påverka både vår organisation och vår bransch under lång tid framöver. Just nu bygger vi ett AI center of excellence, där vi tar fram gemensamma plattformar och riktlinjer för hela Länsförsäkringsgruppen, driver på användningen av nya AI-lösningar och säkerställer återanvändbarhet. Genom detta center stärker vi både lokal innovation och gemensamt lärande, samtidigt som vi ökar kunskap och kompetens i hela organisationen.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av en framtid där AI och data skapar nya möjligheter till proaktiva kundmöten och sömlösa helhetslösningar. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats där du kan växa, utvecklas och vara med och bygga framtiden, på riktigt.
   

  

 Som AI-arkitekt tillhör du vår avdelning Data & AI, men får också breda kontaktytor över hela Länsförsäkringar. Vi är ett av Sveriges ledande företag inom bank, försäkring och fondliv, och vi satsar stort på digitalisering och innovation. Här får du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med engagerade kollegor, samtidigt som du bidrar till att stärka hela vår affär.
   

  

 Du arbetar nära både verksamhet och IT och får vara med och forma hur vi använder AI på ett säkert, ansvarsfullt och skalbart sätt. Hos oss får du vara med och påverka både din egen roll och vår gemensamma framtid.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-02**

title: Data Protection Consultant
description:
SummaryAt Avanade, cybersecurity consultants are innovators, risk-takers, and challengers of the status quo. If you’re an experienced Data Protection Consultant, who can help our clients solve complex Data Protection business challenges, this might be the perfect opportunity for you.Come join us In a client-facing consulting role, you will work on exciting projects that transform our client’s Data Protection solutions through the design and implementation of predominantly Microsoft Data Protection technologies, with a focus on the Microsoft 365 security capabilities. As a member of our security practice, you will work for both Avanade and Accenture clients, ranging from medium to large global enterprise clients. Join a curious and diverse team that’s passionate about next-gen tech and establish yourself as a Leader in the Security space. Together, let’s transform cybersecurity.Key responsibilitiesAs a member of Avanade’s security practice, you will be in a unique position to work for both Avanade and Accenture clients, ranging in size from medium to large global enterprise clients. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the entire Avanade organization by being a collaborative and knowledge-sharing individual, with the real opportunity to help shape the global Avanade security offerings as well as demonstrating your thought-leadership by producing blogs and articles for your region and for Avanade.com. We actively encourage and provide opportunity to undertake innovation, training, and development to ensure you are always at the cutting-edge Microsoft Security technology and our vendor solutions.This is a fantastic opportunity to establish yourself as a leader in the Data Protection space. You will learn how to deliver and solution large and global Data Protections solutions, as well as gain the knowledge and experience of Microsoft’s broader Security, Compliance, and Identity (SCI) ecosystem, which is already recognized as a world-leading integrated security platform.You will:
   

  

* Work with Avanade customers to design and implement Zero Trust architectures using Microsoft security solutions, focusing on data protection.
* Lead the deployment and configuration of:o Microsoft Purview for data governance, compliance, information protection, Insider Risk and Data Loss Preventiono Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Identity, and Cloud Appso Microsoft Defender for Cloud for cloud security posture management
* Develop and maintain data classification, labeling, and retention policies.
* Develop and implement DSPM strategies for AI systems, ensuring secure data flows, model integrity, and privacy compliance.
* Conduct data protection risk assessments and recommend mitigation strategies.
* Support security workshops, discovery sessions, and technical governance activities
* Provide guidance on compliance frameworks, data lifecycle management, and privacy controls
* Provide technical guidance and training to internal teams on Microsoft security tools.
* Stay current with emerging threats, vulnerabilities, and Microsoft product updates.
* Work independently, with occasional validation of work efforts against strategic and operational objectives

title: Lead Developer
description:
I september lanserade vi Kvartals nya digitala plattform, men detta var bara första steget och vi söker nu en driven första inhouseutvecklare och nyckelspelare för våra framtida tekniska satsningar.
   

  

 I din roll som Lead Developer på Kvartal kommer du vidareutveckla vår nya plattform i samråd med produktägare, VD och andra nyckelpersoner. Du utökar och kompletterar den tekniska kompetens som finns hos våra externa partners, och är en central spelare i det framtida utvecklingsteamet här på Kvartal.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
 Som Lead Developer på kvartal ansvarar du för:
   

  

* Utveckling: Vidareutveckla vår plattform i tätt samarbete med interna nyckelpersoner på Kvartal såväl som externa konsulter.
* Teknisk ledning: Planera och vägleda utvecklingsarbetet från idéstadie till driftsättning. Säkerställa att vår plattform fortsätter hålla en hög standard.
* Teamledning och kompetensutveckling: Leda och inspirera nya utvecklare i takt med att utvecklingsteamet utökas. Även hjälpa till med onboarding och personalutveckling.


**Vem är du?**
* Du har flerårig (5+ år) erfarenhet av modern systemutveckling med ramverk som NextJS, React Native - alternativt utvecklat hela applikationer i Java, Typescript och/eller Go.
* Tidigare arbetet med Google Cloud Platform eller AWS
* Du har erfarenhet av att leda eller coacha andra utvecklare, formellt eller informellt.
* Du har god kommunikationsförmåga
* Du är nyfiken, lösningsorienterad och trivs med att skapa struktur i en föränderlig miljö.
* Trivs i en miljö där mycket händer snabbt och med högt i tak
* Är social, lösningsorienterad och ser dig själv som en nyckelspelare snarare än en ensamvarg


 Vi ser också positivt på att du har ett intresse för journalistik.
   

  

**Om Kvartal**
 Kvartal är nästa generations journalistiska plattform med en vision om ett bättre offentligt samtal. Vi publicerar fördjupande texter och poddar och sedan hösten 2025 även löpande nyhetsbevakning av det viktigaste som händer i Sverige och världen.
   

  

 Sedan vår återlansering som kommersiellt bolag hösten 2022 har vi gått från 0 till 30 000 betalande prenumeranter och från 5 till över 25 anställda. Kvartal är därmed Sveriges genom tiderna snabbast växande digitala mediehus.
   

  

**Praktiskt om tjänsten**
 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Omfattning & arbetssätt**
 Heltid, hybridanställd med kontor 2-3 dagar i veckan. Viss helgtäckning kan förekomma och kompenseras med kompdagar.
   

  

 Start: Q4 2025 – intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Innan du skickar in din ansökan: Ta del av Kvartals poddar och övriga innehåll för att förstå vårt varumärke.
   

  

 Ansök via jobb.kvartal.se så snart som möjligt – vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Visa oss hur just du kan lyfta Kvartals digitala tillväxt till nästa nivå!

title: PCB Layout Engineer - Remote
description:
**About Justera Group**  

Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm with great experience specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today’s rapidly changing economy. The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle, from hiring to ongoing management, ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget. With their strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.  

  

**About the Role:**  

We are seeking an experienced PCB Layout Engineer to join our team, contributing to high-power electronics projects. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Cadence design tools and a strong understanding of electronics, manufacturability, and test board design. This role combines hands-on PCB layout work with project coordination responsibilities.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Modify and enhance existing PCB designs, ensuring optimal performance and manufacturability.
* Perform approximately 80% hands-on PCB design and 20% project coordination and meetings.
* Collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary project teams.
* Demonstrate independent problem-solving and a proactive approach to challenges.
* Prioritize efficiency, quality, and timely delivery of design solutions.
* Participate in an initial onsite engagement in Kalmar (1 week), followed by remote work with potential for long-term involvement.
* 

**Requirements:**

* 10+ years of experience using Cadence PCB design tools.
* Proven expertise in high-power electronics and PCB layout for simulation.
* Strong knowledge of stack-up materials, manufacturability, and test board design.
* Experience working in corporate environments.
* Excellent English communication skills; Swedish language skills are a plus.
* Prior experience with major telecom or electronics companies is advantageous
* 

**What We Offer:**

  

* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge robotic technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* Competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance
* 25 days of annual leave to recharge and relax
* An annual wellness allowance of 3,500 SEK to support your health and wellbeing

title: AI Engineer
description:
#### **About Gilion:**


Our mission is clear: We are accelerating founders in their growth journey through our Gilion platform. As a growing product company leveraging AI, we are creating an innovative, technically challenging platform revolutionizing how businesses grow - with the key of the platform being analytics, unique AI forecasting, ultimately enabling access to financing and non-dillutive funding, - in a way never done before. Watch our platform here: gilion.com/platform


Our team is made up of experts who have been part of leading companies like Spotify, Google, King, Sinch, bringing a wealth of experience and a passion for pushing boundaries. At Gilion, you’ll be part of a fast-moving, dynamic environment where your work will have a tangible impact on both our product and the industry as a whole. If you’re excited about working with challenging technology and making a real difference, Gilion is the place for you.

#### **About the role**


You’ll join our AI team to build the core infrastructure powering Gilion’s AI-driven financial analysis. You will:

* Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services that process and serve customer data for AI agents.
* Integrate with AI orchestration systems to ensure agents have access to the right agentic tools (MCPs) and data for their tasks.
* Continuously refine automated analysis workflows to improve accuracy, scalability, and robustness.
* Collaborate with product and engineering teams to extend data capabilities and handle new data types or sources.
* Monitor, optimize, and troubleshoot data pipelines and LLM features in production.

#### **Background / Profile**

* Proven experience as a software engineer / backend engineer and working in a microservice architecture.
* Strong backend development skills (Python, Go or similar), with deep understanding of service design and APIs.
* You’re a strong coder who writes clean, maintainable, and production-ready code.
* You’re excited by the idea of using AI to solve real customer problems and improve product experiences.

#### **What we offer:**

* Work-life balance, hybrid-remote model
* Diverse, inclusive and knowledge-sharing culture
* Experienced founders, backed by top investors
* A growth journey with tons of development opportunities
* AI product that impacts how companies grow, disrupting the industry

title: Backend Engineer - Music
description:
The Rights Systems team is driving the technical foundations of a step-change for Spotify’s business by enabling the distribution of new forms of content across the platform. This challenge involves detection of rights-protected intellectual property and facilitating rightsholder and creator management of both the rights-protected IP and the secondary content. The journey ahead will present the team with the chance to collaborate with teams across the company (Content Platform, Financial Engineering, Label Partnership, Licensing, and others) in order to create and present novel content datasets to end-users. As the product matures, the team will stretch as they scale to broader use cases and a larger user base. Being a cornerstone of the company’s video-first strategy, the rights systems solution space will be an area of investment and growth for the company over the next 2-5 years, and the team is projected to grow from a single squad to a product area.
   

  

 The squad on which this role is a founding member will specialize in Rights data, creating a net new domain within Spotify’s data landscape that is a system of record for IP rights ownership of the content we have on platform at Spotify.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Work with a fullstack team to build and launch backend services & data pipelines that power a new rights database to serve as a source of truth for Spotify.
* Work closely with product, insights, design and other backend engineers to understand the needs our of external customers and internal partners (Music Expression, Content Platform, Financial Engineering, Licensing & Publishing).
* Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality backend code.
* Maintain data pipelines that undergird our Rights ecosystem.
* Support timely delivery of technical solutions to address business needs.
* Advocate and advance modern, agile software development practices and help develop and evangelize great engineering and organizational practices.
* Work with external teams when needed to deliver consumer video experiences in the Spotify consumer application.
* Contribute to a healthy, collaborative team culture in line with what we value.
* Contribute to our team-wide product ideation in collaboration with other specialists, researchers, product managers, and subject-matter experts on the team.
* Work in an environment that supports your individual growth by providing you with exciting work, the freedom to acquire new skills on hack days, reading groups, and a variety of internal training courses.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have a strong command of backend development best practices and a proven track record of delivering DRY, maintainable code that scales across all levels of production-level traffic.
* You are experienced in designing and building distributed, high-volume services in Java or similar languages.
* You have a working understanding of delivering data solutions using Scio and Scala.
* You have some exposure to data warehouses such as BigQuery, Snowflake, etc., and orchestration platforms like Flyte.
* You are accustomed to supporting high throughput user-facing systems in production and apply your learnings from prior incidents when building new features.
* You own your solutions end-to-end, from scoping tickets through to deployment and smoke testing your features in production.
* You ensure the quality of your code with modern testing, debugging and automation techniques.
* You have a solid understanding of object-oriented and functional programming paradigms.
* You proactively identify tech debt and work with your team to get it prioritized.
* You’re interested in rounding out your data skillset to make yourself a stronger web developer.
* You care about software architecture across the front-end, back-end, and the APIs gluing them together.
* You’re excited to learn new problem spaces and domainsYou prioritize team success to create further opportunity for yourself and teammates.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**What We Should Tell You About The Company**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating insanely
 **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours - not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.
   

  

 You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration, always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?
   

  

 As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 and we want to make sure that we have face-to-face time with eachother, which means that we're in the office the majority of the time.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $66K - $143K

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Are you a ready to use your skills for something that truly matters? Maybe you’ve built countless apps, optimized endless user flows, or maintained systems that never quite made a difference in people’s lives. Now, imagine putting your skills to work for something bigger - something that actually changes how healthcare, social services, and elderly care work together in Sweden.
   

  

 We’re building a next-generation platform that will transform collaboration across these vital sectors. We are now looking for experienced Fullstack Developers, who are ready to use their craft to make a real impact.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Meaningful mission: Directly influence the future of Swedish healthcare and social services.
* Technical Leadership: Take ownership of architecture, drive technical decisions, and mentor colleagues.
* Modern tech & AI: Work with React, TypeScript, Java, Spring Boot, Docker, Kubernetes and AI-driven development.
* Growth & collaboration: Learn from talented colleagues and have access to mentorship and growth opportunities.
* Flexible culture: Enjoy flexible working conditions and a friendly culture built on trust and care.


**The position**
 You’ll be part of an agile and innovative team, contributing throughout the entire development lifecycle — from requirements to production-ready services. Depending on your experience, you’ll either grow into the role or take a lead in driving development and mentoring others.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Develop and maintain a modern, API-first platform using test-driven and AI-assisted methods.
* Mentor and support other developers, fostering a culture of technical excellence.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (designers, product owners, domain experts) to deliver secure, scalable, and user-friendly solutions.
* Contribute to architectural decisions for scalability, performance, and security
* Stay at the forefront of technology and share your expertise with the team.


**About You**
 You are curious, eager to learn, and enjoy working with others. You thrive in an environment where you can grow your skills step by step, contribute with your ideas, and collaborate to solve problems together.
   

  

 At Cambio, we value initiative and personal growth. Our culture is built on Trust, Care, and Together values we believe are important to both our work and our people. It’s important to us that you recognize and identify with these values.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A passionate engineer with 5+ years of experience building great products using cutting-edge technologies
* Curiosity about AI and enthusiasm for exploring new technologies.
* Communicates fluently in Swedish and English


**It's a bonus**
* Experience working in our tech stack


**Additional Information**
**Place of employment** 
 : Linköping, Motala or Stockholm
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full-time, hybrid work model (three days per week in-office)
   

  

**Form of employment** 
 : Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

 We review applications and conduct interviews on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

 Short Description
   

  

**Your Role**
 As an Embedded Software Developer, you will focus on developing embedded software, mainly but not exclusively within the Automotive Industry.
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Developing software using C and C++ programming languages.
* Using MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and potentially generating C code.
* Writing unit tests or other test cases (Python).
* Working with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**Your Profile**
* At least 5 years of experience with embedded programming in C/C++.
* Experience with MATLAB and Simulink.
* Experience with hardware-related programming and debugging, including JTAG and other debugging tools.
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS) and experience with embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities, staying ahead of the curve in the ever-evolving automotive landscape.


**Application and Contact**
 Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now since we assign roles during the whole application time span. Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
   

  

 We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.
   

  

*Please note that identity and background checks may be conducted as part of the recruitment process.*
 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.** 




  





 As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the DRM Ingestion Team, which is part of Epidemic Sound’s central Data Engineering organization. Your role will be to build and scale a greenfield data warehouse for large scale social-media music data that will provide critical commercial insights to both internal and external users.
 



  





 The DRM Ingestion Team is responsible for ingesting large-scale music and rights data from social media platforms like YouTube, music rights holders, and other third-party data sources. You will be responsible for transforming and modeling this large-scale data so it can be used to unlock valuable insights into how Epidemic Sound’s music is being used. This is a unique greenfield project where you will have significant influence on the data architecture and tooling for a mission-critical data initiative. This work is key to establishing a new revenue stream and directly informing strategic and commercial decisions across the company.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Build, maintain, and evolve the DRM data warehouse, transforming and modeling large-scale data for a variety of internal and external data consumers.
* Define and implement data architecture and data modeling principles in a greenfield environment.
* Partner closely with other engineers and analytics teams to deliver high-quality, production-ready data products.
* Work directly with business stakeholders to understand requirements and develop solutions that meet their needs.


- 


**Requirements** 



* Strong experience with dbt or other ELT orchestration tools.
* Expertise in SQL, BigQuery, and data modeling.
* A self-starter attitude, able to take ownership and drive work forward independently.
* Curiosity and passion for extracting value from large-scale data.
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience working in smaller companies or early-stage environments, where you’ve taken ownership of data products and worked with rapidly evolving requirements
* Experience with data infrastructure and orchestration
* Experience with dbt Cloud, Airflow, or Apache Beam
* Knowledge of Java, Kotlin, or Go


- 


**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in here - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: Utvecklare till våra mobila plattformar
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens användarupplevelser i en miljö där design och teknik och möts? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med moderna tekniker och vara en nyckelperson i transformationen ny arkitektur. Här får du utvecklas tillsammans med engagerade kollegor och bidra till lösningar som används av många.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som apputvecklare/frontendutvecklare i vårt designsystemteam blir du en viktig del av ett tvärfunktionellt team med fokus på att möjliggöra och dokumentera återanvändbara UI-komponenter. Du arbetar nära UX/design och andra utvecklare för att skapa konsekventa, tillgängliga och skalbara användarupplevelser. Rollen innebär att du både arbetar med dagens native-miljö och driver utvecklingen mot en mer webbaserad och hybrid arkitektur.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Utveckla återanvändbara, tillgängliga och responsiva UI-komponenter för designsystemet
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team tillsammans med UX och arkitektur
* Översätta design tokens till kod och säkerställa konsekvent användning
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla befintliga native-appar (iOS och/eller Android)
* Bidra till transformationen mot hybrid/webb-arkitektur, inklusive Micro Frontends
* Arbeta med kodstandarder, naming conventions och delad frontendarkitektur
* Leda och skapa samsyn med andra utvecklare kring arkitektur, komponentdelning och API-integrationer


**Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst**
* Stark erfarenhet av nativeutveckling i iOS och/eller Android (Kotlin)
* God förståelse för plattformspecifika designmönster och komponentbibliotek
* Kunskap om tillgänglighet och responsivitet i mobila gränssnitt
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och dokumentera återanvändbara UI-komponenter för designsystem
* Förståelse för design tokens och hur dessa implementeras i kod
* Systemtänkande med detaljfokus och förmåga att se helheten
* Vana att arbeta med kodstandarder och delad frontendarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av samverkan kring versionshantering och styrning av designsystem
* Förmåga att leda och skapa samsyn med andra utvecklare kring arkitektur och kodstandarder


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att utveckla webb med moderna JavaScript-ramverk, exempelvis React eller Vue
* Kännedom om eller intresse för Micro Frontend-arkitektur
* Erfarenhet av att bygga appgränssnitt i webbhybrider (t.ex. via WebView)
* Intresse för DevOps och CI/CD för mobil/webb
* Grundläggande förståelse för webbanalys och mätbar UX
* Förmåga att coacha andra utvecklare i frontendkod och komponentstruktur


 Som person är du kommunikativ och pedagogisk, med en genuin vilja att samarbeta och bygga tillsammans med andra. Du förklarar principer och lösningar tydligt och inkluderande för olika målgrupper. Du är coachande och vägleder med ödmjuk expertis, och driver designbeslut utan prestige. Du har ett starkt systemtänkande med detaljfokus, och trivs med att skapa bästa möjliga användarupplevelse där design och teknik samspelar.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Till vardags sitter du i Designsystemteamet och du rapporterar till chefen för Arkitektur, Teknologi och Plattformar inom avdelningen Customer Experience på LFAB. Här värdesätter vi samarbete, innovation och öppenhet. Vi arbetar tillsammans för att skapa hållbara och användarvänliga lösningar, och uppmuntrar till delaktighet och kunskapsutbyte mellan alla roller. Här får du möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas, både i din roll och tillsammans med teamet.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-12-02**

title: Cloud SW Developer
description:
Do you have a passion for cloud software development and IoT? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you! The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for a Cloud Software Developer to join the Wireless Lock product unit in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Here, you’ll thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as a** 
**Cloud Software Developer**
 You would develop web applications for configuring and operating our wireless locks and systems. Your primary focus would be on cloud front-end development, while also contributing to back-end functionality.
   

  

 You would be part of a cross-functional, agile software team that includes mobile and cloud developers, QA specialists, and a UX designer. Collaboration with our firmware team would be essential to understand device functionality and communication. Additionally, you would work closely with product management to support and enhance the cloud software application.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Contribute to planning activities by analyzing requirements, creating specifications, and breaking down implementation work into epics and user stories.
* Investigate and resolve customer-reported issues.
* Participate in end-user testing activities.
* Continuously explore, evaluate, and implement new technologies.


**The Skills And Experience We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in software development, including a minimum of 2 years working with Angular.
* Hands-on experience with backend development, preferably in Go (Golang), and familiarity with RESTful APIs and cloud service integrations.
* Knowledge of test automation tools such as Jest, Playwright, or Cypress, and experience with CI/CD practices using Git.
* A background in Agile Scrum development and strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken.
* A technical education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; a Bachelor's degree or higher is preferred.


 Ideally, you would have experience with several of the following: AWS development (e.g., Lambda, S3, CloudFront), headless CMS—preferably Sanity, AI tools like Cursor and Copilot for code development, and Agile methodologies such as SAFe.
   

  

 You’re a proactive and open-minded individual who takes initiative and enjoys learning. As a natural problem solver, you focus on solutions rather than obstacles. You thrive in cross-functional teams, value collaboration, and are always ready to support others while also seeking help when needed. You share our belief in lean and agile principles and enjoy working in an environment where diverse expertise comes together to drive successful outcomes.
